analyzed: de phyis nges par bsgoms pa'i dus byed pa chos dang yang dag par ldan pas las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin /
translated: Later, when the time of death arrives, they will be accompanied by the Dharma.🔽

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /🔽de las de dang rgyu mthun par rtag tu bde ba dang ldan zhing nor bzang po dang ldan pa dang / lam du 'gro ba na rkang gis mi 'gro ste /🔽rta dang / glang po che dang / dre'u yi bzhon pa la zhon pa dang / rgyal po'am /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na / de las de dang rgyu mthun par rtag tu bde ba dang ldan zhing nor bzang po dang ldan pa dang / lam du 'gro ba na rkang gis mi 'gro ste / rta dang / glang po che dang / dre'u yi bzhon pa la zhon pa dang / rgyal po'am /
translated: Later, when the time comes to meditate, they will be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals, in accordance with their karmic actions.

original: blon po chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: blon po chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: “If they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, in accordance with their causal karmic actions, they will always be happy and wealthy. They will not walk on foot but ride horses, elephants, and mules. They will become kings or great ministers.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then continue to examine the realms of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will notice that the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three have a realm known as Great Beauty.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi @341b gnas; lus kyi mdog bzang zhing che ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi @341b gnas; lus kyi mdog bzang zhing che ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: He saw the realm of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, called Excellent and Great Body Color.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: “What karma causes beings to be born there?”

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na; skyes bu dam pa sems tshul khrims dang ldan pa gang gis tshul khrims rnam pa bdun dang mthun pa'am /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na; skyes bu dam pa sems tshul khrims dang ldan pa gang gis tshul khrims rnam pa bdun dang mthun pa'am /
translated: Investigating by means of knowledge derived from hearing, he saw that when a holy person who is endowed with discipline protects the seven aspects of discipline

original: gzhan nam / phyogs 'ga' legs par bsrungs na /
analyzed: gzhan nam / phyogs 'ga' legs par bsrungs na /
translated: or other aspects of discipline,

original: de rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur la /
translated: he will experience a result that accords with the cause.

original: sems kyis bsgoms pa kho na'am /
analyzed: sems kyis bsgoms pa kho na'am /
translated: If he has cultivated this with his mind

original: lta ba dang ldan pa de srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dag ni shin tu bsrungs /
analyzed: lta ba dang ldan pa de srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dag ni shin tu bsrungs /
translated: and possesses the view, he will protect against killing and stealing.

original: sdom pa skyon med pa ni blangs /
analyzed: sdom pa skyon med pa ni blangs /
translated: He will take up the vows without fault.

original: gcig tu skyes bu dam pa 'dod cing bde ba'i nges pa'i rgyur gyur ba /
analyzed: gcig tu skyes bu dam pa 'dod cing bde ba'i nges pa'i rgyur gyur ba /
translated: This is the cause for being born as a holy being and for attaining happiness.

original: 'jig rten 'di'i sdom pa legs pa zhes bya ba rnam pa de lta bu'i las legs par byas pa /🔽'phags pa ma yin pa'i skyes bu dam pa /🔽ma byin par len pa nyid spong ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i sdom pa legs pa zhes bya ba rnam pa de lta bu'i las legs par byas pa / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skyes bu dam pa / ma byin par len pa nyid spong ba ni /
translated: “The good worldly vow” is a good action of that kind.🔽It is not an ārya but a holy person.🔽It is the abandonment of stealing.🔽

original: 'di la ma byin par len pa chung ngu'ang len par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di la ma byin par len pa chung ngu'ang len par mi byed de /
translated: “ ‘The good people of this world who are not noble beings but who have done good actions and who have given up taking what is not given do not take even the smallest thing that is not given.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽rgya mtsho dang nye ba na'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / rgya mtsho dang nye ba na'am /
translated: They do not take what is not given in this way:🔽They do not take what is not given on the shores of the ocean,

original: 'bab chu dang nye bar gnas pa na; gzhan gyis phyogs gang yin pa dag la gzhan gyi rgya mtsho'i rlabs kyis bdas te 'ongs pa /
analyzed: 'bab chu dang nye bar gnas pa na; gzhan gyis phyogs gang yin pa dag la gzhan gyi rgya mtsho'i rlabs kyis bdas te 'ongs pa /
translated: on the banks of rivers, or in other places where the waves of the ocean have brought up conches,

original: dung ngam / bha la l'a ta ka'am /
analyzed: dung ngam / bha la l'a ta ka'am /
translated: balāka shells,

original: sha bha ri ka'am /
analyzed: sha bha ri ka'am /
translated: śaṃbara shells,🔽or other such things.

original: de dang mthun pa de dag kyang len par mi byed; gzhan gyi nor rdzas kyi rnam pa gzhan dag kyang len par mi byed la nor rdzas kyi rnam pa rtsa'ang las kyi 'bras bu la 'jigs la /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa de dag kyang len par mi byed; gzhan gyi nor rdzas kyi rnam pa gzhan dag kyang len par mi byed la nor rdzas kyi rnam pa rtsa'ang las kyi 'bras bu la 'jigs la /
translated: They do not take other people’s possessions, not even grass, because they are afraid of the consequences of their actions.

original: rgyal po'i chad pas 'jigs pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i chad pas 'jigs pa ma yin pa /
translated: They are not afraid of the king’s punishment.

original: rku @342a *// pa'i sems kyis ma byin par len par mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rku @342a *// pa'i sems kyis ma byin par len par mi byed pa yin te /
translated: They do not steal what is not given, with a mind of theft.

original: rnam pa de lta bu ni ma byin par len pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu ni ma byin par len pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Such is the abandonment of stealing.🔽“What is the aspect of abandoning killing?

original: srog gcod pa spangs pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu yin zhe na; 'di ni legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu yin zhe na; 'di ni legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa /
translated: They are those who practice good actions,

original: 'jig rten pha rol la 'jigs par sems pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la 'jigs par sems pa /
translated: who are afraid of the next world,

original: las kyi 'bras bu la sems dad pa drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu la sems dad pa drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can /
translated: who have faith in the results of actions, who are honest,

original: gzhan la mi gnod pa /
analyzed: gzhan la mi gnod pa /
translated: who are not harmful to others,

original: sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa /
translated: who have abandoned evil companions,🔽and who seek happiness.

original: bde ba tshol ba de lcug ma'i nang du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba tshol ba de lcug ma'i nang du 'gro ba'am /
translated: When they enter a bamboo grove

original: chu rgal ba na grib gnon gyi gdon gyis zin tam /
analyzed: chu rgal ba na grib gnon gyi gdon gyis zin tam /
translated: or cross a river, if they are possessed by a shadow demon

original: srog chags tan tus zin te shi la thug kyang grib gnon gyi gdon de gsad 'dod pa'i phyir dug gis 'thor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: srog chags tan tus zin te shi la thug kyang grib gnon gyi gdon de gsad 'dod pa'i phyir dug gis 'thor bar mi byed de /
translated: or bitten by a poisonous insect, even if they are on the verge of death, they will not scatter poison in order to kill that shadow demon.

original: 'di la gang gi tshe grib ma la dug gtor na /
analyzed: 'di la gang gi tshe grib ma la dug gtor na /
translated: When they scatter poison in a shadow,

original: de'i tshe rang gi grib gnon de'i grib ma de la bab pas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi grib gnon de'i grib ma de la bab pas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the shadow of the person who is casting the shadow falls on the shadow of the other person, and the latter dies.

original: de phyir gnod pa bya ba shes kyang grib gnon gyi gdon de gsod par mi byed do //
analyzed: de phyir gnod pa bya ba shes kyang grib gnon gyi gdon de gsod par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, even though he knows that he should harm the spirit, he does not kill it.

original: srog chags tan tu la slar gnod par bya ba shes kyang gsod par mi byed de /
analyzed: srog chags tan tu la slar gnod par bya ba shes kyang gsod par mi byed de /
translated: Even though he knows that he should harm the creature, he does not kill it.

original: de la chu med par byas na 'chi bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de la chu med par byas na 'chi bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If he deprives it of water, it will die.

original: me long bstan pa'am /
analyzed: me long bstan pa'am /
translated: Or he shows it a mirror.

original: me long rtag tu bstan pas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: me long rtag tu bstan pas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or he always shows it a mirror, and it dies.

original: de phyir gnod par bya ba'i rgyu shes kyang gsod par mi byed la /
analyzed: de phyir gnod par bya ba'i rgyu shes kyang gsod par mi byed la /
translated: Therefore, even though he knows that he should harm it, he does not kill it.

original: rang gi srog chad la thug kyang nyes par bya ba mi byed de /
analyzed: rang gi srog chad la thug kyang nyes par bya ba mi byed de /
translated: Even if it means the loss of his own life, he does not do wrong.

original: de ltar legs par bya ba'i las kyi mtha' byed pa de /
analyzed: de ltar legs par bya ba'i las kyi mtha' byed pa de /
translated: Thus, when he has done what is right,

original: lus dang / @342b bral te shi nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas lus dang / mdog bzang zhing che ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang / @342b bral te shi nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas lus dang / mdog bzang zhing che ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: when he has separated from his body, after death, he goes to the good places, to the world of the gods, to be born among the gods of the Thirty-Three, in the group called Fine Appearance.

original: der skyes nas kyang legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa de /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa de /
translated: Once born there, they will experience the consequences of their past positive actions.

original: rang gi 'od dang ni ldan /
analyzed: rang gi 'od dang ni ldan /
translated: They will be endowed with their own light,

original: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sgra ni 'byin /
analyzed: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sgra ni 'byin /
translated: and the sounds of the five types of instruments will resound.

original: yid shin tu bde ba dang ni ldan /
analyzed: yid shin tu bde ba dang ni ldan /
translated: They will be endowed with the highest mental happiness,

original: 'dod pa thams cad ni 'byor /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad ni 'byor /
translated: and all their wishes will be fulfilled.

original: de lha mo stong gis bskor te ri rab kyi sa gzhi la ni rgyu /
analyzed: de lha mo stong gis bskor te ri rab kyi sa gzhi la ni rgyu /
translated: Surrounded by a thousand goddesses, they will roam the grounds of Mount Sumeru.

original: sa phyogs dzambu n'a da'i gser gyis brgyan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyams dga' ba dang / ri'i zom gyi bar bar dag na dga' zhing bde ba ni myong bar byed do //
analyzed: sa phyogs dzambu n'a da'i gser gyis brgyan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyams dga' ba dang / ri'i zom gyi bar bar dag na dga' zhing bde ba ni myong bar byed do //
translated: In the delightful world systems adorned with the gold of the Jambū River, they will experience joy and happiness in the mountains and valleys.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: They will enjoy all the pleasures of the desire realm.🔽All their wishes will be fulfilled by the wish-fulfilling trees.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing la bsams pas 'dod pa thams cad 'grub pa de yun ring du bde ba myong bar byed do //🔽'khor dang bcas pa yongs su spyod pa de /
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing la bsams pas 'dod pa thams cad 'grub pa de yun ring du bde ba myong bar byed do // 'khor dang bcas pa yongs su spyod pa de /
translated: They will experience such happiness for a long time.

original: phyi rol gyi grib ma zhes bya ba'i tshal der 'dong bar byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi grib ma zhes bya ba'i tshal der 'dong bar byed de /
translated: “Together with their retinues, they will then proceed to the forest known as Outer Shade.

original: dzambu n'a da'i gser gyi shing ljon pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: dzambu n'a da'i gser gyi shing ljon pas brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with golden trees of Jambu River gold,

original: de bzhin du dngul gyi shing ljon pa la gser gyi 'dab ma dang / bee d'urya'i 'bras bus mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngul gyi shing ljon pa la gser gyi 'dab ma dang / bee d'urya'i 'bras bus mdzes pa yin no //
translated: and likewise with silver trees beautified with golden leaves and fruits of beryl.

original: phyi rol gyi grib ma'i tshal de'i phyogs gzhan du'ang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi grib ma'i tshal de'i phyogs gzhan du'ang /
translated: In the other parts of the forest of external shade

original: de res 'ga' yongs su rgyu ba na lus rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan zhing /
analyzed: de res 'ga' yongs su rgyu ba na lus rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan zhing /
translated: he sometimes roams about, his body adorned with the seven precious substances,

original: thig le sna tshogs kyis spras pa /
analyzed: thig le sna tshogs kyis spras pa /
translated: adorned with various patterns,

original: rtog pa sna tshogs can te /🔽rma bya'i tshogs de dag mthong nas legs par blta zhing rtse ba'i phyir der 'gro bar @343a *//
analyzed: rtog pa sna tshogs can te / rma bya'i tshogs de dag mthong nas legs par blta zhing rtse ba'i phyir der 'gro bar @343a *//
translated: and with various thoughts.🔽Seeing those flocks of peacocks, he goes there to see them well and to play.

original: byed do // de de dag gi nang du phyin nas rma bya mthong na yid 'phrog par byed pa de rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: byed do // de de dag gi nang du phyin nas rma bya mthong na yid 'phrog par byed pa de rnams kyi nang na dga' bar byed do //
translated: Having gone among them, seeing the peacocks that captivate the mind, he enjoys himself among them.

original: rma bya de dag gis de mthong nas sil snyan thams cad pas ches lhag pa'i sgra nyams dga' ba chags su rung ba rnam pa sna tshogs du ma 'byin to //
analyzed: rma bya de dag gis de mthong nas sil snyan thams cad pas ches lhag pa'i sgra nyams dga' ba chags su rung ba rnam pa sna tshogs du ma 'byin to //
translated: When the peacocks see this, they produce a delightful sound that surpasses all other instruments.

original: rma bya de'i sgra rnam pa de lta bu 'byin pa de'i khyad par ni lha'i rol mo'i sgra dag bcu drug gi char yang mi phod de /
analyzed: rma bya de'i sgra rnam pa de lta bu 'byin pa de'i khyad par ni lha'i rol mo'i sgra dag bcu drug gi char yang mi phod de /
translated: The sound of the peacocks is so special that the music of the gods does not even come close to a sixteenth of it.

original: rma bya de'i sgra'i drung na lha mo de'i glu dbyangs dag bong skad 'byin pa dang mtshungs so //🔽de nas lha de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rma bya de'i sgra'i drung na lha mo de'i glu dbyangs dag bong skad 'byin pa dang mtshungs so // de nas lha de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Compared to the sound of the peacocks, the singing of the goddesses is like the croaking of frogs.

original: bdag kyang mthu 'di lta bur gyur pas da ni rma bya de dag la zhon te /
analyzed: bdag kyang mthu 'di lta bur gyur pas da ni rma bya de dag la zhon te /
translated: “ ‘The gods will then think, “I too have such power. Now I will ride the peacocks

original: gnas nas gnas dang / tshang tshing nas tshang tshing dang / ri rab kyi ri'i rtse mo nas ri rab kyi ri'i rtse mor lha mo'i tshogs kyis bskor ba dang lhan cig yongs su rgyu zhing de ltar rma bya'i steng du zhon nas /
analyzed: gnas nas gnas dang / tshang tshing nas tshang tshing dang / ri rab kyi ri'i rtse mo nas ri rab kyi ri'i rtse mor lha mo'i tshogs kyis bskor ba dang lhan cig yongs su rgyu zhing de ltar rma bya'i steng du zhon nas /
translated: and travel from one place to another, from one thicket to another, from one peak of Mount Sumeru to another, surrounded by a retinue of goddesses. Riding the peacocks,

original: re zhig 'jig rten gyi dga' ba 'di dag thams cad la blta bar bya'o snyam mo /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten gyi dga' ba 'di dag thams cad la blta bar bya'o snyam mo /
translated: “I will now look at all these worldly delights.”

original: las bya ba legs par byas pa de bsams ma thag tu bong skyed dang / mdog dang / stobs dang / brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: las bya ba legs par byas pa de bsams ma thag tu bong skyed dang / mdog dang / stobs dang / brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: As soon as he had this thought, the horses, which were well trained, beautiful, strong, and energetic,

original: lus rin po che thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i rma bya bzhon du rung bar rked pa stod pa de dag nye bar lhags so //
analyzed: lus rin po che thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i rma bya bzhon du rung bar rked pa stod pa de dag nye bar lhags so //
translated: and which were adorned with all kinds of jewels, came to him.

original: des de dag mthong nas de la zhon pa dang / rma bya de'ang des zhon par rig nas nam mkha'i dkyil na rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: des de dag mthong nas de la zhon pa dang / rma bya de'ang des zhon par rig nas nam mkha'i dkyil na rgyu bar byed do //
translated: When he saw them, he mounted one of the horses, and the horse, knowing that he was mounted, flew up into the sky.

original: de ltar lha de dag kun gyis kyang so sor zhon nas /
analyzed: de ltar lha de dag kun gyis kyang so sor zhon nas /
translated: In the same way, all the gods mounted their own horses.

original: @343b de'i ri rab kyi ri'i rtse mo nas ri'i rtse mo dang / padma'i tshal nas padma'i tshal dang / tshal nas tshal te /
analyzed: @343b de'i ri rab kyi ri'i rtse mo nas ri'i rtse mo dang / padma'i tshal nas padma'i tshal dang / tshal nas tshal te /
translated: Then, from the peak of Mount Sumeru, they went from mountain peak to mountain peak, from lotus grove to lotus grove, and from forest to forest.

original: ri rab kyis phyogs de dag thams cad du de skye bo dang lhan cig mthong na dga' ba rnams la lta bar byed do //
analyzed: ri rab kyis phyogs de dag thams cad du de skye bo dang lhan cig mthong na dga' ba rnams la lta bar byed do //
translated: In all those places, they saw delightful things.

original: de nas de ltar de yongs su rgyu ba na res 'ga' 'jig rten skyong ba dag dzambu'i gling gi bya ba /
analyzed: de nas de ltar de yongs su rgyu ba na res 'ga' 'jig rten skyong ba dag dzambu'i gling gi bya ba /
translated: Then, as he is roaming around, sometimes the guardians of the world will inform the gods about the activities in Jambudvīpa,

original: chos dang / chos ma yin pa dag spran pa'i phyir /🔽rgyal chen bzhi pa'am /
analyzed: chos dang / chos ma yin pa dag spran pa'i phyir / rgyal chen bzhi pa'am /
translated: about what is Dharma and what is not Dharma.🔽They will inform the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyikas

original: sum rtsa gsum du gcig nas gcig tu sbron par byed do //
analyzed: sum rtsa gsum du gcig nas gcig tu sbron par byed do //
translated: or the Trāyastriṃśa gods.

original: de nas lha de dang 'jig rten skyong ba de dag nam mkha' la glo bur du 'ongs te phrad pa dang / lha des de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas lha de dang 'jig rten skyong ba de dag nam mkha' la glo bur du 'ongs te phrad pa dang / lha des de dag la smras pa /
translated: Then, when the gods and the guardians of the world suddenly meet in the sky, the gods will say to them,

original: khyod gang nas 'ongs /
analyzed: khyod gang nas 'ongs /
translated: ‘Where have you come from?’

original: de dag gis lha de la 'di skad smras so //🔽bdag cag ni chos dang / chos ma yin pa sbran pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis lha de la 'di skad smras so // bdag cag ni chos dang / chos ma yin pa sbran pa'i phyir /
translated: The guardians of the world will reply to the gods,

original: dzambu'i gling legs par byas pa'i las kyi gzhi shin tu nyams dga' ba /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling legs par byas pa'i las kyi gzhi shin tu nyams dga' ba /
translated: ‘We have come from Jambudvīpa, where the basis for the performance of good and bad actions is very delightful.

original: chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / kun dga' ra ba mang po phun sum tshogs pa nas mchis so //
analyzed: chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / kun dga' ra ba mang po phun sum tshogs pa nas mchis so //
translated: It is endowed with many rivers, waterfalls, ponds, parks, and gardens.’

original: de nas lha'i bu des 'jig rten skyong ba de dag las thos nas ngo mtshar skyes te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu des 'jig rten skyong ba de dag las thos nas ngo mtshar skyes te /
translated: Then, the god, having heard this from the world guardians, is amazed.

original: mthu chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mthu chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: He is endowed with great power.

original: rma bya mthu chen po la 'ang zhon pa /
analyzed: rma bya mthu chen po la 'ang zhon pa /
translated: He rides a peacock with great power.

original: 'gro ba thams cad du stobs thogs pa med pa'i lha /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad du stobs thogs pa med pa'i lha /
translated: He is a god with unimpeded strength in all his movements.

original: ngo mtshar skyes pa de dzambu'i gling ga la ba der 'bab par byed de; nyi ma gnyis pa ltar gsal zhing lha'i phreng ba dang / gos gyon pa de dzambu'i gling gi tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / chu bo dang / lteng ka dang /
analyzed: ngo mtshar skyes pa de dzambu'i gling ga la ba der 'bab par byed de; nyi ma gnyis pa ltar gsal zhing lha'i phreng ba dang / gos gyon pa de dzambu'i gling gi tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / chu bo dang / lteng ka dang /
translated: Having been amazed, he descends to Jambudvīpa, shining like a second sun, wearing divine garlands and clothes. He sees all of Jambudvīpa with its groves, parks, rivers, ponds,🔽lotus pools, trees, villages,

original: padma'i tshal dang / shing ljon pa dang / grong @344a *//🔽dang / grong khyer dang / tshong 'dus dang ldan pa 'di thams cad la de ltad mo lta bar byed do //
analyzed: padma'i tshal dang / shing ljon pa dang / grong @344a *// dang / grong khyer dang / tshong 'dus dang ldan pa 'di thams cad la de ltad mo lta bar byed do //
translated: towns, and markets.

original: de nas bram ze dag gis de rnams mthong nas rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas bram ze dag gis de rnams mthong nas rtog par byed de /
translated: Then, the brahmins, having seen them, speculate:

original: 'di ltar bya khyung la zhon pa 'di ni gtogs 'dod yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya khyung la zhon pa 'di ni gtogs 'dod yin no //
translated: “This one riding the garuḍa is Kāmadeva.”

original: gzhan dag kyang rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rtog par byed de /
translated: Others also imagine:

original: 'di ltar rma bya la zhon pa 'di ni gzhon nu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rma bya la zhon pa 'di ni gzhon nu yin te /
translated: “This youth who rides on a peacock is Maheśvara.

original: 'jig rten dang / bram ze dag srung bar byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / bram ze dag srung bar byed do //
translated: He protects the world and the brahmins.”

original: gzhan mu stegs pa dag kyang rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs pa dag kyang rtog par byed de /
translated: Other tīrthikas imagine:

original: 'di ltar khyu mchog la zhon pa 'di ni dbang phyug chen po lha dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyu mchog la zhon pa 'di ni dbang phyug chen po lha dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: “This one who rides on a bull is Maheśvara, along with the gods.

original: 'jig rten skyong bar byed /🔽srung bar byed /
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong bar byed / srung bar byed /
translated: He protects the world.🔽He guards it.

original: 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed /
translated: He holds it.

original: skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: skyed par byed cing /
translated: He creates it.

original: 'jig par yang byed do //
analyzed: 'jig par yang byed do //
translated: And he destroys it.

original: de nas yang 'jig rten rnams skyed pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'byin par byed pa yin no zhes rtog ste /
analyzed: de nas yang 'jig rten rnams skyed pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'byin par byed pa yin no zhes rtog ste /
translated: Then again, he creates, maintains, and destroys the world.”

original: de ltar lha de rnams la bram ze dag rnam pa du mar yongs su rtog par byed la /
analyzed: de ltar lha de rnams la bram ze dag rnam pa du mar yongs su rtog par byed la /
translated: In this way, the brahmins imagine the gods in many ways.

original: bstod ra dag byed /
analyzed: bstod ra dag byed /
translated: They praise them.

original: bstan bcos dag byed /
analyzed: bstan bcos dag byed /
translated: They compose treatises.

original: de kho na nyid ma yin pa la de kho na nyid ltar lta /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin pa la de kho na nyid ltar lta /
translated: They see what is not reality as reality.

original: tshig 'khyal ba smra ba yid shin tu rnam par rmongs pa de dag gzhan dag la'ang log pa nyid kyis sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal ba smra ba yid shin tu rnam par rmongs pa de dag gzhan dag la'ang log pa nyid kyis sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Those who speak nonsense, their minds completely confused, will also cause others to engage in error.

original: lha'i bu de rnams kyis ltad mo bltas nas /
analyzed: lha'i bu de rnams kyis ltad mo bltas nas /
translated: The gods watch this spectacle,

original: de nas yang rang gi gnas de nyid du slar 'dod ngo //
analyzed: de nas yang rang gi gnas de nyid du slar 'dod ngo //
translated: and then they return to their own abodes.

original: de ltar lta bar gyur pa'i byis pa rnams de kho na nyid ma yin pa de kho na ltar lta'o //
analyzed: de ltar lta bar gyur pa'i byis pa rnams de kho na nyid ma yin pa de kho na ltar lta'o //
translated: In this way, childish beings, who have become like this, see what is not reality as reality.

original: lha de rnams la lta ba de'ang 'jig pa'i dus su 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: lha de rnams la lta ba de'ang 'jig pa'i dus su 'byung ba'am /
translated: This viewing of the gods occurs at the time of the destruction of the world,

original: res 'ga' cha @344b gnyis ldan pa'am /
analyzed: res 'ga' cha @344b gnyis ldan pa'am /
translated: or it occurs sometimes at the time of the two-part creation,

original: gsum ldan gyi dus na 'byung ste /
analyzed: gsum ldan gyi dus na 'byung ste /
translated: or at the time of the three-part creation.

original: lha de rnams la lta ba ni lta ba ngan pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: lha de rnams la lta ba ni lta ba ngan pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: This viewing of the gods is similar to a bad view.

original: de ltar bdag nyid rab tu rtog par byed la /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid rab tu rtog par byed la /
translated: In this way, they imagine themselves to be like this.

original: bdag nyid kyis rab tu brtags na gzhan dag la'ang sgrogs par byed de /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis rab tu brtags na gzhan dag la'ang sgrogs par byed de /
translated: When they have imagined themselves to be like this, they proclaim this to others.

original: 'di dag ni bram ze rnams kyi lta bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bram ze rnams kyi lta bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: This is the view of the brahmins.

original: de nas lha de rnams slar 'ongs nas lha gzhan de dag la /
analyzed: de nas lha de rnams slar 'ongs nas lha gzhan de dag la /
translated: Then the gods return and say to the other gods,

original: kye ma grogs po dag /
analyzed: kye ma grogs po dag /
translated: ‘Oh my friends!

original: 'di ltar bdag cag sa'i steng du babs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cag sa'i steng du babs te /
translated: We have descended to the ground

original: sa phyogs shin tu rnam par phye ba nyams dga' ba de dag bdag cag gis mthong ngo zhes smras so //
analyzed: sa phyogs shin tu rnam par phye ba nyams dga' ba de dag bdag cag gis mthong ngo zhes smras so //
translated: and seen those delightful and well-ordered places on earth.’

original: de skad thos nas lha gzhan dag kyang bzhon pa sna tshogs la zhon te /
analyzed: de skad thos nas lha gzhan dag kyang bzhon pa sna tshogs la zhon te /
translated: Hearing this, the other gods also mount their various vehicles,

original: rgyan dang / cha byad sna tshogs btags nas dzambu'i gling gal ba der 'bab par byed de /🔽kha cig ni glang po che la zhon /
analyzed: rgyan dang / cha byad sna tshogs btags nas dzambu'i gling gal ba der 'bab par byed de / kha cig ni glang po che la zhon /
translated: adorn themselves with various ornaments and attire, and descend to Jambudvīpa.🔽Some ride elephants,

original: kha cig ni ma he la zhon /
analyzed: kha cig ni ma he la zhon /
translated: some ride buffaloes,

original: kha cig ni rma bya la zhon; kha cig ni bzhon pa med par nam mkha' la 'dug ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni rma bya la zhon; kha cig ni bzhon pa med par nam mkha' la 'dug ste /
translated: some ride peacocks, and some sit in the sky without any vehicle.

original: de rnams kyis sa phyogs nyams dga' ba thams cad la lta bar byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis sa phyogs nyams dga' ba thams cad la lta bar byed do //
translated: They all look at the delightful places on earth.

original: de dag bltas nas sa phyogs nyams dga' pa lteng ka dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / ne'u gsing ga la yod pa der 'bab par byed do //
analyzed: de dag bltas nas sa phyogs nyams dga' pa lteng ka dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / ne'u gsing ga la yod pa der 'bab par byed do //
translated: Having seen them, they descend to the ground in delightful places, such as lotus ponds, parks, and meadows.

original: tshal gyi phyogs de dag gi nang na bram ze kha cig dka' thub drag po spyod pa yod de /
analyzed: tshal gyi phyogs de dag gi nang na bram ze kha cig dka' thub drag po spyod pa yod de /
translated: In those parks, some brahmins practice severe austerities.

original: de ltar thos pa ngan pa dang mtshungs shing thos pa ngan pa dang 'brel ba dag /
analyzed: de ltar thos pa ngan pa dang mtshungs shing thos pa ngan pa dang 'brel ba dag /
translated: Those who have heard bad teachings and are connected with bad teachings

original: gang gi che phan tshun grogs dang bcas pa de dag sa phyogs de la lta ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi che phan tshun grogs dang bcas pa de dag sa phyogs de la lta ba de'i tshe /
translated: are mutually friends. When they see that place,

original: tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze @345a *//
analyzed: tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze @345a *//
translated: the brahmins who practice in the parks

original: de dag gis lha de rnams mngon sum du mthong nas gzhan dag la sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis lha de rnams mngon sum du mthong nas gzhan dag la sgrogs par byed do //
translated: directly see those gods and proclaim it to others.

original: gang sa phyogs 'dir skyes pa de ni rang dgar kun tu brtags pa zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang sa phyogs 'dir skyes pa de ni rang dgar kun tu brtags pa zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: What is born in this place is called self-imagined.

original: sngon thos pa dang 'brel pas rjod par byed de /
analyzed: sngon thos pa dang 'brel pas rjod par byed de /
translated: They speak based on what they have heard before.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni bram ze'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni bram ze'o //
translated: They say, This is a brahmin.

original: 'di ni gtogs 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gtogs 'dod do //
translated: This is a Kṣatriya.

original: 'di ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: This is Maheśvara.

original: 'di ni gzhon nu'i zhes de ltar so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhon nu'i zhes de ltar so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: This is Kumāra.

original: sa phyogs 'di ni lha chen po'i gnas yin no //🔽'di ni gtogs 'dod kyi'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di ni lha chen po'i gnas yin no // 'di ni gtogs 'dod kyi'o //
translated: This is the abode of Maheśvara.🔽This is the abode of Nārāyaṇa.

original: 'di ni gzhon nu'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhon nu'i'o //
translated: This is the abode of Kumāra.

original: 'di ni tshangs pa'i yin no zhes de ltar rab tu brtags nas /
analyzed: 'di ni tshangs pa'i yin no zhes de ltar rab tu brtags nas /
translated: This is the abode of Brahmā.

original: gtan tshigs dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba lta ba ngan pa dang 'brel pa'i bstan bcos dag kyang byed do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba lta ba ngan pa dang 'brel pa'i bstan bcos dag kyang byed do //
translated: Having thus examined, they compose treatises connected with bad views, with reasons, applications, and conclusions.

original: de nyid la de dag gis gzhan dang / gzhan dag kyang 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid la de dag gis gzhan dang / gzhan dag kyang 'jog par byed do //
translated: They establish other and other [views] in just that [treatise].

original: de ltar de bdag nyid kyis lta ba ngan pa mngon par brtags nas gzhan dag la'ang sgrogs par byed la /🔽de dag kyang gzhan la sgrogs /
analyzed: de ltar de bdag nyid kyis lta ba ngan pa mngon par brtags nas gzhan dag la'ang sgrogs par byed la / de dag kyang gzhan la sgrogs /
translated: Thus, having themselves imagined bad views, they proclaim them to others.🔽And others proclaim them to others.

original: de dag kyang yang gzhan la sgrogs par byed de /
analyzed: de dag kyang yang gzhan la sgrogs par byed de /
translated: And others proclaim them to others.

original: de ltar rim pa de dag gis lta bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rim pa de dag gis lta bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: In this way, they become views through these stages.

original: gang gi tshe lha de rnams mtho ris kyi dga' ba dang mthun par mtsho dang nye bar 'khod dam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha de rnams mtho ris kyi dga' ba dang mthun par mtsho dang nye bar 'khod dam /
translated: When the gods are in the vicinity of the lake, in harmony with the joys of the higher realms,

original: de bzhin du mtsho'i nang du zhugs pa de la tshal gyi nang na spyod par rang dgar goms pa de dag gzhan la sgrogs par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtsho'i nang du zhugs pa de la tshal gyi nang na spyod par rang dgar goms pa de dag gzhan la sgrogs par byed de /
translated: they enter the lake and, accustomed to enjoying the forest, they proclaim:

original: 'di ltar mtsho 'di ni tshangs @345b ba'i yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtsho 'di ni tshangs @345b ba'i yin no //
translated: “This lake belongs to Brahmā!

original: 'di ni skal ldan sred med kyi bu'i yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni skal ldan sred med kyi bu'i yin no //
translated: This one belongs to the fortunate Nārāyaṇa!

original: 'di ni dbang phyug chen po'i yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang phyug chen po'i yin no //
translated: This one belongs to Maheśvara!

original: 'di ni gzhon nu'i yin no zhes de ltar lta ba ngan pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems kyis gtan tshigs dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos dag byed la /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhon nu'i yin no zhes de ltar lta ba ngan pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems kyis gtan tshigs dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos dag byed la /
translated: This one belongs to Kumāra!” In this way, their minds are under the sway of bad views, and they compose treatises that contain reasons, examples, applications, and conclusions.

original: de ltar gzhan dag la bstan bcos rab tu grags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag la bstan bcos rab tu grags par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, their treatises become well known to others.

original: de ltar gzhan dang / gzhan du lta bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dang / gzhan du lta bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: In this way, they have different views in different places.

original: de nas yang rnam pa gzhan gyis rab tu rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang rnam pa gzhan gyis rab tu rtog par byed de /
translated: Then, they conceive it in another way.

original: de kho na nyid khong du chud par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid khong du chud par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “ ‘They will then continue to investigate in other ways, but they will not understand reality.

original: tshal gyi nang na spyod pa de dag gis lha de rnams gsal bar mi mthong ste /
analyzed: tshal gyi nang na spyod pa de dag gis lha de rnams gsal bar mi mthong ste /
translated: “ ‘The brahmins who roam the forests will not see the gods clearly,

original: byad gzugs ma nor bar shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byad gzugs ma nor bar shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will not understand their forms correctly.

original: de nas kyang lha de rnams me ltar gzi brjid 'bar zhing yul nas yul du 'dong bar byed; tshal nas tshal du 'dong bar byed pa dang / tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze gang yin pa de dag gzhan du rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas kyang lha de rnams me ltar gzi brjid 'bar zhing yul nas yul du 'dong bar byed; tshal nas tshal du 'dong bar byed pa dang / tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze gang yin pa de dag gzhan du rtog par byed de /
translated: “ ‘The gods will then move from place to place, blazing like fire, and from forest to forest. The brahmins who roam the forests will then investigate in other ways, thinking,

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid me'i nang du mngon par bcug pa de dag ni rgyu de dang / rkyen des lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar gzhan du brtags nas lta ba'i rnam pa skyed bar byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid me'i nang du mngon par bcug pa de dag ni rgyu de dang / rkyen des lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar gzhan du brtags nas lta ba'i rnam pa skyed bar byed la /
translated: “Those who have immersed themselves in the fire have, by that cause and condition, separated from their bodies and are now born among the gods in the higher realms of the joyous gods.” Thus, they will form other ideas and give rise to views.

original: gtan tshigs dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba ngan pa dang 'brel pa'i bstan bcos dag kyang byed do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba ngan pa dang 'brel pa'i bstan bcos dag kyang byed do //
translated: They also compose treatises that are connected with bad reasoning, examples, applications, and conclusions.

original: de nas gzhan dag gis bstan bcos de dag thos @346a *//
analyzed: de nas gzhan dag gis bstan bcos de dag thos @346a *//
translated: Then, others, having heard those treatises,

original: nas bdag nyid me'i nang du 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: nas bdag nyid me'i nang du 'jug par byed de /
translated: enter into the fire.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, they fall into a false view.

original: de rnams ni las kyi 'bras bu spong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnams ni las kyi 'bras bu spong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: They abandon the results of karma.

original: de spangs pas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spangs pas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning that, they fall into the lower realms and are born in the hells.

original: de nas gzhan yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa sgrub pa ni tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze dag gis lha de rnams rgyang ring po zhig na lta ba mi gsal bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa sgrub pa ni tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze dag gis lha de rnams rgyang ring po zhig na lta ba mi gsal bar mthong ste /
translated: “ ‘Then, as for the accomplishment of the aspects of false views, the brahmins who wander in the forests see those gods from a distance, but not very clearly.

original: 'di ltar ri'i rtse mo me tog dang / lteng ka phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag la lha 'dzegs nas gzi brjid 'bar zhing nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / de nas tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze dag gis mthong nas rang dgar rtog bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ri'i rtse mo me tog dang / lteng ka phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag la lha 'dzegs nas gzi brjid 'bar zhing nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / de nas tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze dag gis mthong nas rang dgar rtog bar byed de /
translated: Then, when brahmans who enjoy the forest see this, they imagine it is due to their own power and say,

original: 'di ltar mir gyur pa 'di rnams kyis ri las g-yang du ltung bar byas na rgyu de dang / rkyen des bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar mir gyur pa 'di rnams kyis ri las g-yang du ltung bar byas na rgyu de dang / rkyen des bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur bas /
translated: “When these humans throw themselves off a mountain, by that cause and condition they are reborn among the gods in the higher realms of the gods.”

original: bdag cag kyang ri rtse nas thar bar bya'o zhes de ltar gzhan dag la'ang ston par byed la /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang ri rtse nas thar bar bya'o zhes de ltar gzhan dag la'ang ston par byed la /
translated: “We also will throw ourselves off the peak of a mountain.”

original: bstan bcos ngan pa dag kyang byed cing las kyi 'bras bu la'ang skur pa 'debs so //
analyzed: bstan bcos ngan pa dag kyang byed cing las kyi 'bras bu la'ang skur pa 'debs so //
translated: In this way, they teach others and compose bad treatises that slander the effects of karma.

original: las kyi 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa bdag dang / gzhan log par lta ba rnams ni lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa bdag dang / gzhan log par lta ba rnams ni lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba /
translated: Those who deny the effects of karma and have wrong views about themselves and others will, upon separating from their bodies, fall into the lower realms.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “ ‘Those who deny the effects of karmic actions, those who have wrong views about themselves and others, will, upon separating from their bodies, fall into the lower realms and be born in the hells.

original: de ltar yang lta ba'i rnam pa gzhan yin @346b no; ;de nas yang tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze de dag gis /
analyzed: de ltar yang lta ba'i rnam pa gzhan yin @346b no; ;de nas yang tshal gyi nang na spyod pa'i bram ze de dag gis /
translated: “ ‘In this way, there are other aspects of views.

original: lha de rnams gzhan du mthong nas rang dgar gzhan du rtog par byed de /
analyzed: lha de rnams gzhan du mthong nas rang dgar gzhan du rtog par byed de /
translated: The brahmins who roam the forests will see the gods in other ways and thus imagine other things.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They will think,

original: lha rnams ha cang yang mi nye /
analyzed: lha rnams ha cang yang mi nye /
translated: “The gods are neither too close nor too far away.🔽They are situated in such a way that we can see their forms and attire.

original: ha cang yang mi ring ba zhig na 'khod pa de rnams kyi cha byad gzugs cung zad cig shes pa dang / de bzhin du mthong nas gzugs de rnams gzhan nyid du rtog par byed de /
analyzed: ha cang yang mi ring ba zhig na 'khod pa de rnams kyi cha byad gzugs cung zad cig shes pa dang / de bzhin du mthong nas gzugs de rnams gzhan nyid du rtog par byed de /

analyzed: der skyes nas kyang byad gzugs bzang por 'gyur te /

original: shin tu byad gzugs bzang po dang ldan pa dang / skye bo thams cad yang dag par dga' ba dang / dbang po tshangs pa dang / nor rdzas dam pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: shin tu byad gzugs bzang po dang ldan pa dang / skye bo thams cad yang dag par dga' ba dang / dbang po tshangs pa dang / nor rdzas dam pa dang ldan te /
translated: They will have an excellent body and be delightful to all beings. Their faculties will be pure and they will possess the best wealth.

original: rgyal po'am / blon po chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: rgyal po'am / blon po chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: They will become kings or great ministers.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realms of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas kyi nor bu 'phyang ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas kyi nor bu 'phyang ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: Wondering what sort of place the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three have, he will apply insight derived from hearing and so correctly perceive the following.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: “What sort of karmic actions cause beings to take birth there?”

original: blo rgya che zhing tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur la /🔽legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa /🔽rtag tu las dang / 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la lta ba sems dam pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: blo rgya che zhing tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur la / legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa / rtag tu las dang / 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid la lta ba sems dam pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Inquiring into this matter with insight derived from hearing, he will notice how some people are of vast mind and endowed with discipline.🔽They engage in wholesome actions and always observe the reality of actions and their effects.

original: yang @349b dang / yang du las dang / 'bras bu la dad par gyur ba gang gis /
analyzed: yang @349b dang / yang du las dang / 'bras bu la dad par gyur ba gang gis /
translated: They are of pure mind and have faith in actions and their effects.

original: dge ba'i las byas la mi dge ba spangs pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i las byas la mi dge ba spangs pa /
translated: They perform virtuous actions and avoid unwholesome ones.

original: drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can /
translated: They are honest and of honest character.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po dag mi bsten cing /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po dag mi bsten cing /
translated: They do not associate with evil companions.

original: de dag dang lhan cig dga' bar yang mi byed la /
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig dga' bar yang mi byed la /
translated: They do not enjoy being with them.

original: lam du 'grogs pa na tshigs kyang smra bar mi byed la /
analyzed: lam du 'grogs pa na tshigs kyang smra bar mi byed la /
translated: When walking on the road, he does not even speak a verse.

original: mig zur gyis kyang lta bar mi byed de /
analyzed: mig zur gyis kyang lta bar mi byed de /
translated: He does not even look with the corner of his eye.

original: de ltar kun nas dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa /
analyzed: de ltar kun nas dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa /
translated: Thus, he practices wholesome actions in every way.🔽He is like refined gold.

original: gser sbyangs pa dang mtshungs pa de legs par bya ba byas pa de /
analyzed: gser sbyangs pa dang mtshungs pa de legs par bya ba byas pa de /
translated: He has done what is good.

original: tshe 'di la gzhan yang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la gzhan yang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is also loved by others in this life.

original: legs par bya ba byas pa ji lta bu zhig /
analyzed: legs par bya ba byas pa ji lta bu zhig /
translated: What is it like to have done what is good?

original: rnam pa ni du zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa ni du zhe na /
translated: What are the aspects?

original: 'di ni mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa kha ton slob pa la zhugs pa'i dge slong nyin mtshan du brtson pa gang dag mar me med pa'i gzhis /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa kha ton slob pa la zhugs pa'i dge slong nyin mtshan du brtson pa gang dag mar me med pa'i gzhis /
translated: This is for monks who are engaged in studying the sūtras, the vinaya, and the abhidharma, who are diligent day and night, who are able to study the Buddha’s scriptures without a lamp.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab slob ma nus pa de mar me med nas kha ton slob pa btang ste 'dug pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab slob ma nus pa de mar me med nas kha ton slob pa btang ste 'dug pa la /
translated: When they are unable to study the sūtras due to lack of a lamp, they stop studying and sit.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la gus shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la gus shing /
translated: They have respect for the Buddha’s scriptures.

original: dge slong de rnams la'ang sems dad pas bsgoms pa'i snying dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dge slong de rnams la'ang sems dad pas bsgoms pa'i snying dang ldan pa /
translated: They have a heart that is cultivated with faith in those monks.

original: chos dang / dge 'dun la gus pa /
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun la gus pa /
translated: They have respect for the Dharma and the Saṅgha.

original: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa skyes pa de dge 'dun zhing chen po de la mar me dag 'bul bar byed la /🔽gzhan yang dge ba nyis 'gyur du byed du 'jug pa dang / de ltar dge slong de rnams brtson 'grus bya ba'i don du yul las tsha bar zhugs pa rnams la bsil yab sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa skyes pa de dge 'dun zhing chen po de la mar me dag 'bul bar byed la / gzhan yang dge ba nyis 'gyur du byed du 'jug pa dang / de ltar dge slong de rnams brtson 'grus bya ba'i don du yul las tsha bar zhugs pa rnams la bsil yab sbyin par byed do //
translated: They will offer lamps to the great field of the saṅgha, the Three Jewels in whom they have faith.🔽They will also cause others to engage in twice as much virtue.

original: des dge slong rnams dge ba'i phyogs @350a *//🔽byed de; tsha ba bsal ba dang / mar me byin pas /
analyzed: des dge slong rnams dge ba'i phyogs @350a *// byed de; tsha ba bsal ba dang / mar me byin pas /
translated: In this way, they will offer cooling fans to the monks who are engaged in diligence, who have entered the heat of the Dharma, and who are engaged in virtue.

original: de dag mun pa'i mi bde ba dang bral zhig tsha ba'i gnod pa dang bral te /
analyzed: de dag mun pa'i mi bde ba dang bral zhig tsha ba'i gnod pa dang bral te /
translated: The monks will be free from the discomfort of darkness and the harm of heat.

original: kun nas shin tu bde ba dang ldan la /
analyzed: kun nas shin tu bde ba dang ldan la /
translated: They will be endowed with complete and utter bliss.

original: ngal sor yod pa tshangs par spyod pa de /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' bde bar slob par byed /
analyzed: ngal sor yod pa tshangs par spyod pa de / thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' bde bar slob par byed /
translated: They will rest in the practice of pure conduct.🔽They will study the words of the Omniscient One with ease.

original: sems par byed la thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' 'dri ba dang / lan gla na pa la phan tshun kha ton slob par byed de /
analyzed: sems par byed la thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' 'dri ba dang / lan gla na pa la phan tshun kha ton slob par byed de /
translated: They will contemplate the words of the Omniscient One, and they will mutually teach and recite them.

original: mar me'i yon tan de dang / bsil yab kyi rlung bsil ba des dge slong rnams mun pa'i mi bde ba dang bral zhing tsha ba'i gnod pa dang bral te /
analyzed: mar me'i yon tan de dang / bsil yab kyi rlung bsil ba des dge slong rnams mun pa'i mi bde ba dang bral zhing tsha ba'i gnod pa dang bral te /
translated: The light of the lamps and the cool breeze from the fans free the monks from the discomfort of darkness and the harm of heat.

original: sbyin bdag de'i mthus bde ba lag tu kha ton slob par byed /
analyzed: sbyin bdag de'i mthus bde ba lag tu kha ton slob par byed /
translated: By the power of the benefactor, they are happy and recite their lessons.

original: yang dag par sems par byed /
analyzed: yang dag par sems par byed /
translated: They reflect correctly.

original: yid shin tu brtson par gyur na /
analyzed: yid shin tu brtson par gyur na /
translated: They become very diligent.

original: de ltar bdag dang / gzhan la phan par zhugs pa'i skyes bu dge ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur ba de /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang / gzhan la phan par zhugs pa'i skyes bu dge ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur ba de /
translated: Thus, the virtuous person who is engaged in benefiting both self and others, who is endowed with discipline,

original: lus dang bral nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten nor bu 'phyang ba'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten nor bu 'phyang ba'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after separating from the body, after death, will be born in the happy realms, in the world of the gods of the Cāturmaṇḍala Heaven.

original: der skyes nas kyang legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' mngon sum du gyur pa de shin tu bde ba'i rgyu legs par byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'i skal pa la ni spyod //
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' mngon sum du gyur pa de shin tu bde ba'i rgyu legs par byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu'i skal pa la ni spyod //
translated: Having been born there, the one who has directly experienced the results of virtuous actions will experience the results of virtuous actions, the causes of great happiness.

original: ji ltar nyi ma rang las 'od 'byung ba de bas bcu 'gyur gyis lhag pa'i 'od kyi phreng ba ni 'byung /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma rang las 'od 'byung ba de bas bcu 'gyur gyis lhag pa'i 'od kyi phreng ba ni 'byung /
translated: From the sun, a garland of light rays that is ten times greater than its own light rays shines forth.

original: lha'i tshogs thams cad kyis shin tu bkur pa na lha mo du ma 'bum snyed rim @350b gro bya ba'i phyir ni 'ong /
analyzed: lha'i tshogs thams cad kyis shin tu bkur pa na lha mo du ma 'bum snyed rim @350b gro bya ba'i phyir ni 'ong /
translated: When the sun is greatly revered by all the hosts of gods, many hundreds of thousands of goddesses come to serve it.

original: lha mo gus pa skyes pa de rnams ji ltar snga nas bshes pa ltar yid gcugs par gyur cing /
analyzed: lha mo gus pa skyes pa de rnams ji ltar snga nas bshes pa ltar yid gcugs par gyur cing /
translated: The goddesses who have developed respect for the sun become as trusting as if they were old friends.

original: bzhin 'dzum la rgyan thams cad kyis klubs pas gang ba rnams ni /
analyzed: bzhin 'dzum la rgyan thams cad kyis klubs pas gang ba rnams ni /
translated: With smiling faces and adorned with all types of jewelry,

original: byad gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rgyan lhag par bzang ba dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / dbyibs legs pa dang / lus legs pa yin la /
analyzed: byad gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rgyan lhag par bzang ba dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / dbyibs legs pa dang / lus legs pa yin la /
translated: they have excellent bodies, attire, and jewelry, and they are beautiful, well-proportioned, and well-formed.

original: phun tshun 'thab mo dang / phrag dog dang / 'jigs pa'i ngo bo ni med /
analyzed: phun tshun 'thab mo dang / phrag dog dang / 'jigs pa'i ngo bo ni med /
translated: They do not fight with each other, are not jealous, and have no fear.

original: gcig la gcig yid gcugs pa ni skyes /
analyzed: gcig la gcig yid gcugs pa ni skyes /
translated: They trust each other and

original: gnod pa med pa'i snying dang ldan pa rnams phan tshun 'bral bar dga' ba skad cig tsam yang med de /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i snying dang ldan pa rnams phan tshun 'bral bar dga' ba skad cig tsam yang med de /
translated: have hearts that are free from harm. They do not enjoy being apart from each other for even a moment.

original: de skad cig kyang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de skad cig kyang nyams pa med do //
translated: He never loses it for even a moment.

original: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa kun yid rab tu dga' bar gyur nas thams cad kyis kyang padma dag blangs te lha de'i drung du 'dong bar byed do //🔽kha cig gis ni gser gyi padma blangs /
analyzed: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa kun yid rab tu dga' bar gyur nas thams cad kyis kyang padma dag blangs te lha de'i drung du 'dong bar byed do // kha cig gis ni gser gyi padma blangs /
translated: When they have all become very happy, they take the lotuses and go to the god.🔽Some take golden lotuses.

original: kha cig gis ni dngul gyi padma /🔽kha cig gis ni bee d'urya'i padma /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni dngul gyi padma / kha cig gis ni bee d'urya'i padma /
translated: Some take silver lotuses.🔽Some take lapis lazuli lotuses.

original: kha cig gis ni shel gyi padma /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni shel gyi padma /
translated: Some take crystal lotuses.

original: kha cig gis ni rin po che dang 'dres pa dag blangs te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rin po che dang 'dres pa dag blangs te /
translated: Some take lotuses mixed with jewels.

original: 'di ltar gang gi lag na dngul gyi padma yod pa de'i padma'i sdong bu ni gser /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi lag na dngul gyi padma yod pa de'i padma'i sdong bu ni gser /
translated: Thus, for those whose lotuses are silver, the lotus stalks are gold.

original: ze ba ni padma r'a ga'i mdog yin no //🔽gang gi padma bee d'urya'i padma yin na de'i sdong bu ni gser yin no //🔽gang gi padma gser yin na de'i me tog aanda rnyil yin no //
analyzed: ze ba ni padma r'a ga'i mdog yin no // gang gi padma bee d'urya'i padma yin na de'i sdong bu ni gser yin no // gang gi padma gser yin na de'i me tog aanda rnyil yin no //
translated: The anthers are the color of ruby.🔽For those whose lotuses are lapis lazuli, the stalks are gold.🔽For those whose lotuses are gold, the flowers are sapphire.

original: gang gi padma spug yin na de'i sdong bu aanda rnyil yin no //
analyzed: gang gi padma spug yin na de'i sdong bu aanda rnyil yin no //
translated: For those whose lotuses are coral, the stalks are sapphire.

original: gang gi lag na padma dmar po thogs na de'i ze ba ni rdo rje'i mdog lta bu @351a *//
analyzed: gang gi lag na padma dmar po thogs na de'i ze ba ni rdo rje'i mdog lta bu @351a *//
translated: In the hands of those holding red lotuses, the anthers are the color of vajra.

original: yin te / de ltar lha mo de rnams lha de'i drung du 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: yin te / de ltar lha mo de rnams lha de'i drung du 'dong bar byed do //
translated: In this way, the goddesses approach the god.

original: dong nas kyang yid gcugs pa de la kun nas padma char ltar 'bebs te /
analyzed: dong nas kyang yid gcugs pa de la kun nas padma char ltar 'bebs te /
translated: Having approached, they rain down a shower of lotuses on the god, who is their friend.

original: ji ltar dbyar gyi dus rnams su sprin gyi rgyal po dag las char kyi rgyun mngon par 'bab pa de ltar lha de la lha mo de rnams kyis padma'i char 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar dbyar gyi dus rnams su sprin gyi rgyal po dag las char kyi rgyun mngon par 'bab pa de ltar lha de la lha mo de rnams kyis padma'i char 'bebs par byed do //
translated: Just as in the rainy season a rain of water falls from the kings of clouds, in the same way the goddesses rain down a shower of lotuses on the god.

original: lha de skyes ma thag nyid du dang por lha mo de rnams mthong nas /
analyzed: lha de skyes ma thag nyid du dang por lha mo de rnams mthong nas /
translated: As soon as the god is born, he first sees the goddesses.

original: lha rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi snying g-yo bar byed na yid shin tu dga' bar gyur pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi snying g-yo bar byed na yid shin tu dga' bar gyur pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If the natural essence of the gods moves the heart, what need is there to mention that the mind becomes extremely joyful?

original: de skyes ma thag tu dang por de rnams mthong nas 'dod chags kyis 'phangs pa'i yid dang / ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i snying rab tu dga' ba dang / yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad kyang dga' bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de skyes ma thag tu dang por de rnams mthong nas 'dod chags kyis 'phangs pa'i yid dang / ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i snying rab tu dga' ba dang / yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad kyang dga' bar gyur nas /
translated: As soon as it arises, first they see those goddesses, and their minds are propelled by desire, their hearts are filled with wonder, and all their major and minor body parts are filled with joy.

original: mod nyid la stan de nas lha mo de rnams ga la ba de rgyug par byed do //
analyzed: mod nyid la stan de nas lha mo de rnams ga la ba de rgyug par byed do //
translated: Immediately, they rush from their seats to where the goddesses are.

original: 'dod chags skyes pa de dag phan tshun 'dres par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags skyes pa de dag phan tshun 'dres par gyur nas /
translated: When desire arises, they mix with one another.

original: de nas yang lha mo de rnams dang lha de yang dang / yang du dga' ba nyid lhag par bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas yang lha mo de rnams dang lha de yang dang / yang du dga' ba nyid lhag par bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to further increase the joy of the goddesses and the god,🔽they dance.

original: shin tu bro gar byed /🔽rgod par byed /
analyzed: shin tu bro gar byed / rgod par byed /
translated: They laugh.

original: glu len par byed do //
analyzed: glu len par byed do //
translated: They sing.

original: de nas lha de lha mo de rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas /
analyzed: de nas lha de lha mo de rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas /
translated: Then, the god surrounded by the goddesses

original: tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rin po che sna tshogs 'bar ba /
analyzed: tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rin po che sna tshogs 'bar ba /
translated: goes to the forests and parks that blaze with the light of various jewels,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with all the qualities of desire.

original: shing ljon pa rnams dang / shing ljon pa'i drung rnams dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shing ljon pa rnams dang / shing ljon pa'i drung rnams dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with trees and the foot of trees.

original: bya sna tshogs 'dres shing @351b sgra 'byin pa thos na snyan pa /
analyzed: bya sna tshogs 'dres shing @351b sgra 'byin pa thos na snyan pa /
translated: The sounds of various birds are heard, and they are delightful.

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu'i phyogs ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin 'grub pa /
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu'i phyogs ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin 'grub pa /
translated: Flowers and fruits are produced according to one’s wishes.

original: chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka rnams 'bum snyed kyis gang ba'i tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal de rnams su /
analyzed: chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka rnams 'bum snyed kyis gang ba'i tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal de rnams su /
translated: In those forests and parks, which are filled with hundreds of thousands of rivers, waterfalls, and ponds,

original: lha de lha mo de rnams dang lhan cig gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'dong bar byed de /
analyzed: lha de lha mo de rnams dang lhan cig gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'dong bar byed de /
translated: the gods go together with the goddesses to enjoy themselves.

original: rang gis byas pa'i las mngon sum du gyur pa des /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i las mngon sum du gyur pa des /
translated: Due to their own actions that have become manifest,

original: bde ba dpe med pa rnams pa du ma dag myong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba dpe med pa rnams pa du ma dag myong ngo //
translated: they experience many kinds of incomparable pleasures.

original: de nas de de rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas rtse zhing /
analyzed: de nas de de rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas rtse zhing /
translated: Then, surrounded by the goddesses, they play to the accompaniment of the five types of musical instruments.

original: 'dod pa thams cad bsams na 'grub pa lus kyi mtha' rgya chen po byed pa'i lha de; 'phags pa'i tshul khrims de la brten pa'i 'bras bu la spyod par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad bsams na 'grub pa lus kyi mtha' rgya chen po byed pa'i lha de; 'phags pa'i tshul khrims de la brten pa'i 'bras bu la spyod par byed do //
translated: “ ‘The gods who have the power to fulfill all wishes and who have the vast range of the body will experience the results of their reliance on the noble discipline.

original: de nas de ltar lha de de rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas /
analyzed: de nas de ltar lha de de rnams kyis yongs su bskor nas /
translated: “ ‘Thus, surrounded by the gods,

original: lha de rnams dang yang nor bu 'phyang ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha de rnams dang yang nor bu 'phyang ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: they will proceed to Hanging in Cords.

original: lha gzhan rnams kyis de dag mthong nas /
analyzed: lha gzhan rnams kyis de dag mthong nas /
translated: When the other gods see them,

original: yid rab tu dga' ba gus pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: yid rab tu dga' ba gus pa dang bcas pa /
translated: they will be filled with joy and respect.

original: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba rnams /
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba rnams /
translated: Surrounded by their retinues of gods and goddesses,

original: lha gsar du byung ba de ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha gsar du byung ba de ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: they will approach the newly arrived gods.

original: gus pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis de la gnyen ltar sems shing thams cad yid rab tu dga' bas lha de'i drung du dong ngo //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis de la gnyen ltar sems shing thams cad yid rab tu dga' bas lha de'i drung du dong ngo //
