original: dga' ba'ang med la 'khrug pa'ang med do //
analyzed: dga' ba'ang med la 'khrug pa'ang med do //
translated: He is neither happy nor upset.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi mtha' ni rgud par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas; 'di ltar rang gi las la spyod pa /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi mtha' ni rgud par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas; 'di ltar rang gi las la spyod pa /
translated: He knows that the end of all prosperity is decline.

original: las kyi rlung gis gtor ba rnams sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang na 'khyam zhing /
analyzed: las kyi rlung gis gtor ba rnams sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang na 'khyam zhing /
translated: Thus, he observes his own actions, and he sees that the beings who are scattered by the winds of karma wander in the realms of hell beings, starving spirits, and animals.

original: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs 'grogs pa 'di thams cad dang bral ba'i lha rnams shi nas gar 'gro /
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs 'grogs pa 'di thams cad dang bral ba'i lha rnams shi nas gar 'gro /
translated: He sees that the gods who are separated from the gatherings of gods and goddesses die and go elsewhere.

original: kye ma / byis pa so so'i skye bo bslus pa 'di dag thams cad ni las byas pa chen po myong ngo snyam du nang du yid la sems par byed do //
analyzed: kye ma / byis pa so so'i skye bo bslus pa 'di dag thams cad ni las byas pa chen po myong ngo snyam du nang du yid la sems par byed do //
translated: He thinks, ‘Alas, all these deceived ordinary beings experience the great ripening of their actions.’

original: de nas de'i tshe brgya byin gyis 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe brgya byin gyis 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: “At that point Śakra will utter the following verses:

original: nam mkha' la ni sprin chags pa //🔽rlung gis kun tu gtor ba rnams //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni sprin chags pa // rlung gis kun tu gtor ba rnams //
translated: Just as clouds gather in the sky

original: 'dus pa dag kyang 'gyes pa ltar //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag kyang 'gyes pa ltar //
translated: and are then dispersed by the wind,

original: 'khor pa'i srog chags de bzhin no //🔽ji ltar dus tshigs dus tshigs su //
analyzed: 'khor pa'i srog chags de bzhin no // ji ltar dus tshigs dus tshigs su //
translated: so it is with the beings of cyclic existence.🔽Just as people see flowers

original: me tog byung ba mi yis mthong //
analyzed: me tog byung ba mi yis mthong //
translated: blooming in each season,

original: dus tshigs thams cad thal gyur na //
analyzed: dus tshigs thams cad thal gyur na //
translated: but when all the seasons have passed,

original: ji @357b ltar byung ba so sor 'jig /
analyzed: ji @357b ltar byung ba so sor 'jig /
translated: they disappear one by one,

original: de ltar legs par byas pa'i lha //
analyzed: de ltar legs par byas pa'i lha //
translated: so it is with the gods who have acted well.

original: dus su byung na dga' byed la //
analyzed: dus su byung na dga' byed la //
translated: When the time has come, they enjoy themselves,

original: dge ba'i dus ni thal gyur na //🔽ji ltar byung ba so sor 'jig /🔽ji ltar dus tshigs dus tshigs su //
analyzed: dge ba'i dus ni thal gyur na // ji ltar byung ba so sor 'jig / ji ltar dus tshigs dus tshigs su //
translated: but when the time for virtue has passed,🔽they disappear one by one.🔽Just as many leaves grow

original: shing lo du ma skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: shing lo du ma skye 'gyur ba //
translated: in each season,

original: dus tshigs dus ni thal 'gyur na //
analyzed: dus tshigs dus ni thal 'gyur na //
translated: but when the season is over,

original: de dag kun nas 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag kun nas 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: they all perish,

original: de ltar lha rnams lo ma 'dra //
analyzed: de ltar lha rnams lo ma 'dra //
translated: so it is with the gods, who are like leaves.

original: srid pa 'di ni shing lta bu //
analyzed: srid pa 'di ni shing lta bu //
translated: This existence is like a tree.

original: bde ba rtag tu 'jig 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde ba rtag tu 'jig 'gyur te /
translated: Happiness always perishes

original: brtan pa dang ni rtag pa med //
analyzed: brtan pa dang ni rtag pa med //
translated: and is neither stable nor permanent.

original: ji ltar char pa 'bab dus na //
analyzed: ji ltar char pa 'bab dus na //
translated: Just as when it rains

original: mkha' la char 'bab ldog pa med //
analyzed: mkha' la char 'bab ldog pa med //
translated: The rain that falls from the sky cannot be stopped.

original: de ltar bde ba 'di dag kun //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba 'di dag kun //
translated: In the same way, all these pleasures

original: 'gro bar 'gyur te log pa med //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur te log pa med //
translated: will come to an end, there is no turning back.🔽Just as the feathers of a peacock

original: ji ltar rma bya'i sgro dag ni; ;rlung gis kun tu khyer gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar rma bya'i sgro dag ni; ;rlung gis kun tu khyer gyur pa //
translated: are carried away by the wind,

original: de ni zad par bya phyir 'jig /
analyzed: de ni zad par bya phyir 'jig /
translated: they will be destroyed and exhausted.

original: bde ba'i gzhi ni de dang 'dra //
analyzed: bde ba'i gzhi ni de dang 'dra //
translated: The basis of pleasure is like that.

original: ji ltar mer ni shing bcug na //
analyzed: ji ltar mer ni shing bcug na //
translated: Just as when wood is put into fire,

original: nges par rab tu sreg par byed //
analyzed: nges par rab tu sreg par byed //
translated: it will definitely be burned,

original: de ltar dus ni me dang 'dra //
analyzed: de ltar dus ni me dang 'dra //
translated: so time is like fire

original: mi rnams shing skam lta bu yin //
analyzed: mi rnams shing skam lta bu yin //
translated: and humans are like dry wood.

original: brgya'am yang na stong dag tu //
analyzed: brgya'am yang na stong dag tu //
translated: Whether a hundred or a thousand times,

original: 'di dag 'ong dang 'gro 'gyur yang //
analyzed: 'di dag 'ong dang 'gro 'gyur yang //
translated: they will come and go.

original: de ltar sred pas rmongs pa 'di //
analyzed: de ltar sred pas rmongs pa 'di //
translated: In this way, deluded by craving,

original: yang dag rig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag rig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not know the truth.

original: sred dang rmongs pa'i mig 'phrul gyis //
analyzed: sred dang rmongs pa'i mig 'phrul gyis //
translated: The magic of craving and delusion

original: thams cad du ni rnam par gang //
analyzed: thams cad du ni rnam par gang //
translated: fills everything.

original: ji ltar dge skal ma yin pa //🔽de ltar lha rnams rab tu bslus //
analyzed: ji ltar dge skal ma yin pa // de ltar lha rnams rab tu bslus //
translated: Just as they are not fortunate,🔽so the gods are thoroughly deceived.

original: de ltar brgya byin des lha de rnams la snying rje bskyed nas /
analyzed: de ltar brgya byin des lha de rnams la snying rje bskyed nas /
translated: In this way, Śakra, having generated compassion for those gods,

original: de nas yang glang po che sa srung gi bu de la zhon te /
analyzed: de nas yang glang po che sa srung gi bu de la zhon te /
translated: Then, riding on the elephant Airāvaṇa,

original: lha'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: lha'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: surrounded by the hosts of gods,

original: sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dbyangs sna tshogs len bzhin du lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang de nyid du 'dong @358a *//🔽bar byed de /
analyzed: sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dbyangs sna tshogs len bzhin du lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang de nyid du 'dong @358a *// bar byed de /
translated: and accompanied by the sounds of various musical instruments, he goes to Sudharmā, the assembly hall of the gods.

original: chos bzang na gnas pa rgyal ba thob pa dag la lha gzhan rnams kyis mchod cing spyin te /
analyzed: chos bzang na gnas pa rgyal ba thob pa dag la lha gzhan rnams kyis mchod cing spyin te /
translated: There, the gods who have attained victory in Sudharmā make offerings and give gifts to the other gods.🔽The gods who live in the Hanging Garden are insatiable in their desires.

original: nor ba 'phyang ba na gnas pa'i lha 'dod pas tshim pa med pa rnams ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa /
analyzed: nor ba 'phyang ba na gnas pa'i lha 'dod pas tshim pa med pa rnams ji srid du 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa /
translated: As long as the actions they have performed and accumulated that are attractive, delightful, and enjoyable,

original: so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de zad pa dang / spangs pa dang / zhig par ma gyur ba de srid du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro rnams kyis tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams kyi nang na rtse bar byed /🔽dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de zad pa dang / spangs pa dang / zhig par ma gyur ba de srid du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro rnams kyis tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams kyi nang na rtse bar byed /🔽dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: and that are to be individually experienced, have not been exhausted, relinquished, and destroyed, they will continue to play and enjoy themselves in the forests and parks with forms, sounds, smells, and tastes.

original: de de nas shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin /
analyzed: de de nas shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin /
translated: After dying there, they go to the next place in accordance with their karma.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: When they later die and transmigrate, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals.

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par rigs rgya chen po'i nang du skye la /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par rigs rgya chen po'i nang du skye la /
translated: “If they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, in accordance with their causal actions they will be born into a family of great means,

original: shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa dang / bong tshod che zhing bzang ba dang / yul dbus su skye ba dang / chos bzang po dang ldan pa dang / shin tu 'byor pa dang / bu dang / tsha bo dang / ldan pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa dang / bong tshod che zhing bzang ba dang / yul dbus su skye ba dang / chos bzang po dang ldan pa dang / shin tu 'byor pa dang / bu dang / tsha bo dang / ldan pa dang /
translated: enjoying great happiness, with a large and beautiful body, born in a central country, endowed with excellent qualities, very wealthy, with many sons and nephews,

original: yun ring du gnas pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i bran khol bdog pa dang / skye bo thams cad dga' ba dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / rgyal po'am /
analyzed: yun ring du gnas pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i bran khol bdog pa dang / skye bo thams cad dga' ba dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / rgyal po'am /
translated: living a long life, with servants and slaves who are free from harm, and endowed with the love of all people. They will become kings

original: blon po chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: blon po chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: or great ministers.🔽“

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: Again, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karma🔽

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog @358b par byed de /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog @358b par byed de /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then examine the realm of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha rnams kyi gnas ris mthun pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //🔽der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha rnams kyi gnas ris mthun pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see the realm of the gods known as Similar.🔽Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will examine this matter with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa /
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa /
translated: He will then notice how some people who engage in wholesome actions

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi mtha' yang dag par bsdams pa /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi mtha' yang dag par bsdams pa /
translated: and who are restrained in their physical, verbal, and mental conduct

original: g-yo sgyu med pa /
analyzed: g-yo sgyu med pa /
translated: are free from deceit.

original: gzhan la mi gnod pa /
analyzed: gzhan la mi gnod pa /
translated: They do not harm others

original: blo gros rtag tu rgya che ba /
analyzed: blo gros rtag tu rgya che ba /
translated: and their minds are always vast.

original: drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can sdig pa'i grogs po spong ba /
analyzed: drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can sdig pa'i grogs po spong ba /
translated: They are honest and truthful, and they avoid unwholesome company.

original: gang thabs kun gyis sdig pa'i grogs po spong bar byed la /
analyzed: gang thabs kun gyis sdig pa'i grogs po spong bar byed la /
translated: They avoid unwholesome company by all means.

original: de dang lhan cig 'dre bar mi byed /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'dre bar mi byed /
translated: They do not associate with such people.

original: de dang tshig kyang mi smra /
analyzed: de dang tshig kyang mi smra /
translated: They do not speak with them.

original: de la mig zur tsam yang mi lta /
analyzed: de la mig zur tsam yang mi lta /
translated: They do not even glance at them.

original: lam du yang lhan cig mi 'grogs /
analyzed: lam du yang lhan cig mi 'grogs /
translated: They do not walk with them.

original: de mthong nas kyang rtag tu spong bar byed la /
analyzed: de mthong nas kyang rtag tu spong bar byed la /
translated: When they see them, they always avoid them.

original: de'i grogs po gang yin pa de'ang spong bar byed /
analyzed: de'i grogs po gang yin pa de'ang spong bar byed /
translated: They also avoid those who are their friends.

original: btsun pa dag la rten par byed cing /
analyzed: btsun pa dag la rten par byed cing /
translated: They rely on the venerable ones.

original: rtag tu dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i ngang tshul can yin la /
analyzed: rtag tu dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i ngang tshul can yin la /
translated: They always have the character of listening to the holy Dharma.

original: de thos nas dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyang rnam par shes /
analyzed: de thos nas dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyang rnam par shes /
translated: Having heard it, they know the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral dharmas.

original: spang bar bya ba spong bar byed la /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba spong bar byed la /
translated: They know what should be abandoned and what should not be abandoned.

original: spang bar mi bya ba'ang spang bar mi bya ba rab tu shes nas yid la legs par byed pa dang / shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa dang / dran pa dang / sems kyi dbang du mi 'gro bar dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: spang bar mi bya ba'ang spang bar mi bya ba rab tu shes nas yid la legs par byed pa dang / shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa dang / dran pa dang / sems kyi dbang du mi 'gro bar dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
translated: They know what should be done and what should not be done. They are well-disposed in mind, well-composed, mindful, and not under the control of the mind. They are established in mindfulness.

original: brkam chags med pa dang / tshul khrims rnam pa bdun rjes su skyong la rdul tsam yang 'khrul ba med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra mo rdul tsam la'ang 'jigs par lta ba dang kun nas las dag la @359a *//
analyzed: brkam chags med pa dang / tshul khrims rnam pa bdun rjes su skyong la rdul tsam yang 'khrul ba med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra mo rdul tsam la'ang 'jigs par lta ba dang kun nas las dag la @359a *//
translated: They are not greedy, they maintain the sevenfold discipline without the slightest error, they regard even the slightest misdeed as something frightful, and they are free from the two kinds of conceit.

original: dri ma med pa yin te /
analyzed: dri ma med pa yin te /
translated: They are free from greed, maintain the sevenfold discipline, and are not confused even about the smallest details. They regard even the smallest negative action with fear and are completely pure in their actions.

original: gser btso ma ltar skyon med pa srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa de dang / de dag spong bar byed la /
analyzed: gser btso ma ltar skyon med pa srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa de dang / de dag spong bar byed la /
translated: They are flawless like refined gold. They give up killing and stealing,

original: sbyin pa'ang byin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'ang byin /
translated: and they give generously.

original: bsod nams kyang byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams kyang byed do //
translated: They create merit.

original: srog chags dag thar bar byed pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽'di ni rgyal po'am /
analyzed: srog chags dag thar bar byed pa ji lta bu yin zhe na / 'di ni rgyal po'am /
translated: How do they liberate living beings?🔽If a king or a minister arrests a man or a woman who is engaged in an activity,

original: blon pos skyes pa dang / bud med bya ba byed la lhan cig bzung nas bcings te /
analyzed: blon pos skyes pa dang / bud med bya ba byed la lhan cig bzung nas bcings te /
translated: binds them,

original: grong khyer gyi lho phyogs kyi sgor khrid la; rnga brdungs nas ming dang / rus kyang bsgrags te /🔽grogs byed pa su'ang med /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi lho phyogs kyi sgor khrid la; rnga brdungs nas ming dang / rus kyang bsgrags te / grogs byed pa su'ang med /
translated: leads them to the southern gate of the city, beats the drum, proclaims their name and clan,

original: mi dga' la 'jigs /
analyzed: mi dga' la 'jigs /
translated: and says, ‘No one is allowed to help them!🔽They are not to be liked or loved!’

original: bzhin mog mog par gyur pa dur khrod logs su kha bstan te khrid pa dang / des nor rdzas kyis bslus te thar par byed pa dang / gzhan yang sbyin pa gtong /
analyzed: bzhin mog mog par gyur pa dur khrod logs su kha bstan te khrid pa dang / des nor rdzas kyis bslus te thar par byed pa dang / gzhan yang sbyin pa gtong /
translated: Moreover, he gives gifts

original: bsod nams dag byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed pa yin no //
translated: and makes merit.

original: dge ba dag ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba dag ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are virtuous actions?

original: de ltar de gal te chu nyung ba mya ngam gyi phyogs su dge 'dun gnas par gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar de gal te chu nyung ba mya ngam gyi phyogs su dge 'dun gnas par gyur la /
translated: Thus, if the Saṅgha is staying in a place with little water and is🔽in a desolate region,

original: de yang dge slong dag skom gyis srog chad la thug ste /🔽shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dang / des gnas pa de rnams kyi don du kun dga' ra ba'i dbus su rdzing bu'am /🔽khron pa dag byas la /
analyzed: de yang dge slong dag skom gyis srog chad la thug ste / shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dang / des gnas pa de rnams kyi don du kun dga' ra ba'i dbus su rdzing bu'am / khron pa dag byas la /
translated: the monks are on the verge of dying of thirst🔽and are in great distress,🔽he makes a pond or a well in the middle of the monastery grounds for their sake.

original: chu phyung ba de dag gi nang 'dam rdzab kyis gang ngam /
analyzed: chu phyung ba de dag gi nang 'dam rdzab kyis gang ngam /
translated: He digs out the water and fills it with mud.

original: srin bu rnams kyis yog pa dang / de dag la de las byed de /
analyzed: srin bu rnams kyis yog pa dang / de dag la de las byed de /
translated: It is covered with insects, and he works on it.

original: srin bu de dag sa skam po dag la 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: srin bu de dag sa skam po dag la 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order that those insects will not die on dry land,

original: gsher sa'i phyogs gzhan du 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: gsher sa'i phyogs gzhan du 'jog par byed do //
translated: and he places them in another part of the pond.

original: de ltar srog gcod pa chung ngu'ang srung bar byed do //🔽gzhan du'ang 'bab chu dag gi nang na srin bu gnas pa @359b de dag kyang blangs nas de nas yang srog btsa' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar srog gcod pa chung ngu'ang srung bar byed do // gzhan du'ang 'bab chu dag gi nang na srin bu gnas pa @359b de dag kyang blangs nas de nas yang srog btsa' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In this way, he protects even the smallest creatures.

original: chu yod pa'i phyogs rnams su 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: chu yod pa'i phyogs rnams su 'jog par byed de /
translated: Moreover, he takes the insects that live in the water of the streams and places them in a place where there is water so that they may live.

original: de ltar kun nas dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa ni srog gcod par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa ni srog gcod par mi byed do //
translated: In this way, he who practices wholesome actions does not kill.

original: ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How does he avoid taking what is not given?

original: 'di ni rku sems kyis rtsa ba'ang len par mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rku sems kyis rtsa ba'ang len par mi byed pa yin te /
translated: He does not take even roots with the intention of stealing.

original: phyogs dag na shing dang / smyig ma'i ldum bu skyes pa'ang len par mi byed /
analyzed: phyogs dag na shing dang / smyig ma'i ldum bu skyes pa'ang len par mi byed /
translated: He does not take the trees and bamboo that grow in the area.

original: gzhan du 'phos pa'i grong dang / kun dga' ra ba rnying pa dag gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba med la /
analyzed: gzhan du 'phos pa'i grong dang / kun dga' ra ba rnying pa dag gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba med la /
translated: In the old villages and parks that have been abandoned, which are not owned by anyone,

original: da dung du sus kyang 'dzin par mi 'gyur gyis kyang /
analyzed: da dung du sus kyang 'dzin par mi 'gyur gyis kyang /
translated: and which no one has taken possession of,🔽he does not take anything.

original: sngon gzhan gyis bsgrubs pa zhig yin no snyam du yid la sems par byed la /
analyzed: sngon gzhan gyis bsgrubs pa zhig yin no snyam du yid la sems par byed la /

translated: Wherever the female birds sit, the male birds will sit there as well.

original: me tog gi char gang na yod par de rnams 'thung ba dang bya de dag kyang de na 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: me tog gi char gang na yod par de rnams 'thung ba dang bya de dag kyang de na 'thung bar byed do //
translated: Wherever there is a rain of flowers, they drink it and the birds also drink it there.

original: me tog gi dog pa dag gi nang ga la bar lus zhugs pa dang der yang bya de dag de bzhin du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: me tog gi dog pa dag gi nang ga la bar lus zhugs pa dang der yang bya de dag de bzhin du 'jug par byed do //
translated: Wherever there is a flower bed, they enter with their bodies and there the birds also enter in the same way.

original: yul gang dag btad nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang der yang bya de dag 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: yul gang dag btad nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang der yang bya de dag 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Wherever they are directed to go in the sky, they go there and the birds also go there in the same way.

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa dag la de rnams kyi mchus za ba dang / de dag kyang de bzhin du 'bras bu de nyid la za bar byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa dag la de rnams kyi mchus za ba dang / de dag kyang de bzhin du 'bras bu de nyid la za bar byed do //
translated: Wherever there are fruits, they peck at them with their beaks and the birds also eat those very fruits in the same way.

original: padma'i tshal ga la bar de rnams la gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'dong ba dang de dag kyang de bzhin du de rnams dang lhan cig phyogs de'i padma'i rdzing nyid du 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: padma'i tshal ga la bar de rnams la gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'dong ba dang de dag kyang de bzhin du de rnams dang lhan cig phyogs de'i padma'i rdzing nyid du 'dong bar byed do //
translated: Wherever there are lotus ponds, they go there to stay and the birds also go to those very lotus ponds in the same way.

original: lhan cig spyod pa bya mo rnams ri'i @362b rtse mo ga la bar 'dong ba dang de dag kyang mgul du skud pas btags pa bzhin du de rnams kyi dbang du gyur nas 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa bya mo rnams ri'i @362b rtse mo ga la bar 'dong ba dang de dag kyang mgul du skud pas btags pa bzhin du de rnams kyi dbang du gyur nas 'dong bar byed do //
translated: The hens, his companions, went to the top of the mountain, and he, like one tied by the neck with a string, came under their control and went with them.

original: de bzhin du bung ba mo dag padma'i gsab gseb tu 'dong ba dang / bung ba rnams kyang 'dong la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bung ba mo dag padma'i gsab gseb tu 'dong ba dang / bung ba rnams kyang 'dong la /
translated: In the same way, the female bees went to the lotus grove, and the male bees went with them.

original: ri dvags mo rnams kyis kyang ri dvags dag dbang du byas /
analyzed: ri dvags mo rnams kyis kyang ri dvags dag dbang du byas /
translated: The female deer brought the male deer under their control.

original: lha mo rnams kyis kyang lha dag dbang du byas te /
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyis kyang lha dag dbang du byas te /
translated: The goddesses brought the gods under their control.

original: de dag ni dbyar gyi dus su mtsho gcig tu chus gang bar gyur pa ltar shin tu lhod po lhod po thar bar dka' ba'i bcing bas bsdams pa /
analyzed: de dag ni dbyar gyi dus su mtsho gcig tu chus gang bar gyur pa ltar shin tu lhod po lhod po thar bar dka' ba'i bcing bas bsdams pa /
translated: They were all bound by the bonds of lust, which are very loose, difficult to escape, and difficult to bear, like a lake filled with water in the summer season.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni bud med kyi dbang du gyur par rig nas /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni bud med kyi dbang du gyur par rig nas /
translated: Knowing that all of them were under the control of women,🔽the monk spoke this verse:

original: dge slong des 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa; zhags pa'i nang na 'di dam ste //
analyzed: dge slong des 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa; zhags pa'i nang na 'di dam ste //
translated: “Among snares, this one is the strongest,

original: 'di ltar bud med zhags pa dam //
analyzed: 'di ltar bud med zhags pa dam //
translated: For the snare of women is the strongest.

original: 'di yis bcings pa'i mi rnams ni //
analyzed: 'di yis bcings pa'i mi rnams ni //
translated: People who are bound by this

original: srid pa'i brtson rar rgyug par byed //🔽zhags pas mgul bcings zhags min gyi //
analyzed: srid pa'i brtson rar rgyug par byed // zhags pas mgul bcings zhags min gyi //
translated: run into the prison of existence.🔽Not a rope around the neck, but a rope of the heart—

original: snying zhags bud med 'di mi bzad //
analyzed: snying zhags bud med 'di mi bzad //
translated: this woman is terrible.

original: snying gi zhags pas bcings pa yi //
analyzed: snying gi zhags pas bcings pa yi //
translated: People who are bound by the rope of the heart

original: mi rnams sdug bsngal skal ba can //
analyzed: mi rnams sdug bsngal skal ba can //
translated: are unfortunate, miserable.

original: zhags pa bsreg cing gtub tu rung //
analyzed: zhags pa bsreg cing gtub tu rung //
translated: A rope can be burned and cut,

original: bud med zhags pa sreg mi rung //🔽dmyal ba yi dvags dud 'gro'i nang //
analyzed: bud med zhags pa sreg mi rung // dmyal ba yi dvags dud 'gro'i nang //
translated: but the rope of a woman cannot be burned.🔽She makes you go and follow

original: 'gro zhing rjes su 'gro bar byed //🔽lus can tshogs su ldan pa la //
analyzed: 'gro zhing rjes su 'gro bar byed // lus can tshogs su ldan pa la //
translated: among hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.🔽The great rope binds the collection

original: zhags pa chen pos 'ching bar byed //🔽de bzhin lus med sems 'di la //
analyzed: zhags pa chen pos 'ching bar byed // de bzhin lus med sems 'di la //
translated: of embodied beings.🔽In the same way, the rope of a woman

original: bud med zhags pas 'ching bar byed //
analyzed: bud med zhags pas 'ching bar byed //
translated: binds this embodied mind.

original: gang gis skye bo 'ching byed pa //
analyzed: gang gis skye bo 'ching byed pa //
translated: The rope that binds people

original: zhags pa de ni tshad gzung rung //
analyzed: zhags pa de ni tshad gzung rung //
translated: can be measured.

original: bud med kyi ni 'ching ba'i tshe //
analyzed: bud med kyi ni 'ching ba'i tshe //
translated: But when the rope of a woman binds,

original: de ni tshad gzung mi rig go /🔽'dis ni re zhig dga' @363a *//
analyzed: de ni tshad gzung mi rig go / 'dis ni re zhig dga' @363a *//
translated: it cannot be measured.🔽This shows how difficult it is to be free

original: ba dang // kun nas thar bar dka' ba yi //
analyzed: ba dang // kun nas thar bar dka' ba yi //
translated: from the pleasure and pain🔽of the world.

original: zhags pas bcings pa'i mi rnams ni //
analyzed: zhags pas bcings pa'i mi rnams ni //
translated: People bound by snares

original: srid pa'i mtsho las mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: srid pa'i mtsho las mi 'grol lo //
translated: are not freed from the ocean of existence.

original: zhags pas mgul lam lus gcig cig /
analyzed: zhags pas mgul lam lus gcig cig /
translated: If a single binding of a neck or a body

original: 'ching byed gal te 'ching mi byed //
analyzed: 'ching byed gal te 'ching mi byed //
translated: by a snare does not bind,

original: bud med zhags pa chen po 'di //
analyzed: bud med zhags pa chen po 'di //
translated: this great snare of women

original: dbang po drug rnams 'ching bar byed //
analyzed: dbang po drug rnams 'ching bar byed //
translated: binds the six senses.

original: lcags sam shing ngam gser ma gang yin pa /
analyzed: lcags sam shing ngam gser ma gang yin pa /
translated: Whether it is iron, wood, or gold,

original: 'ching ba 'di ni dam par 'phags mi gsung //
analyzed: 'ching ba 'di ni dam par 'phags mi gsung //
translated: this binding is not said to be firm.

original: blo zhan bu smad rnams la lta ba gang //
analyzed: blo zhan bu smad rnams la lta ba gang //
translated: The mind of one of little intelligence who looks at his wife

original: kun tu chags pa'i sems ni dam zhes gsung //
analyzed: kun tu chags pa'i sems ni dam zhes gsung //
translated: and is attached is said to be firm.

original: de ltar dge slong de 'dod pa la smod par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de 'dod pa la smod par byed do //
translated: Thus, the monk disparages desire.

original: de nas lha de bud med mchog de rnams kyis kun nas dga' ba nyid kyi zhags pas bcings nas /
analyzed: de nas lha de bud med mchog de rnams kyis kun nas dga' ba nyid kyi zhags pas bcings nas /
translated: Then, the god, having bound the supreme women with the snare of delight,

original: tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal mthong na yid 'phrog pa rnam pa sna tshogs gang dag dpe bya bar yang sla ba ma yin pa de dag tu khrid do //
analyzed: tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal mthong na yid 'phrog pa rnam pa sna tshogs gang dag dpe bya bar yang sla ba ma yin pa de dag tu khrid do //
translated: leads them to the various groves and parks that are so captivating that it is not easy to describe them.

original: de nas de ltar lha de dga' mgur spyod pa na res 'ga' padma'i tshal /🔽ngang pa'i padma'i tshal zhes bya ba der de lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor nas 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas de ltar lha de dga' mgur spyod pa na res 'ga' padma'i tshal / ngang pa'i padma'i tshal zhes bya ba der de lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor nas 'gro bar byed do //
translated: “When the gods enjoy themselves in this way, they will sometimes go to a lotus grove known as the Swan Lotus Grove.🔽Surrounded by gatherings of goddesses, they will go there.

original: padma'i tshal de'ang lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs mang pos yongs su bskor nas dga' bar byed pa /🔽'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams kyis dga' bar byed /
analyzed: padma'i tshal de'ang lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs mang pos yongs su bskor nas dga' bar byed pa / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams kyis dga' bar byed /
translated: In this lotus grove, the gods and goddesses enjoy themselves in the company of many other gods and goddesses.

original: rtse bar byed /
analyzed: rtse bar byed /
translated: They enjoy themselves with the five sense pleasures, which they have mastered and with which they are endowed.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: They play and enjoy themselves.🔽Surrounded by goddesses, they will go to a mountain known as Mountainous Peak.

original: lha mos yongs su bskor ba ris mthun pa'i lha rnams sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sgra 'byung ba chags su @363b rung ba snyan pa lha thams cad mthun par yid 'phrog par byed pa /
analyzed: lha mos yongs su bskor ba ris mthun pa'i lha rnams sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i sgra 'byung ba chags su @363b rung ba snyan pa lha thams cad mthun par yid 'phrog par byed pa /
translated: The gods of the same type will play music with the five types of instruments, and the delightful and captivating sounds will please all the gods.

original: shin tu 'dod pa ston par byed pas lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: shin tu 'dod pa ston par byed pas lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
translated: The gods will enjoy themselves together with the goddesses, who are so desirable.

original: de rnams gser gyi ri las gser gyi ri gzhan la 'dzeg par byed de /
analyzed: de rnams gser gyi ri las gser gyi ri gzhan la 'dzeg par byed de /
translated: The gods will climb from one golden mountain to another.

original: thams cad kyang nyams dga' ba rgya che zhing dga' bar byed pa'i yul gyi rjes su 'jug go /
analyzed: thams cad kyang nyams dga' ba rgya che zhing dga' bar byed pa'i yul gyi rjes su 'jug go /
translated: They all enjoy themselves in delightful, vast, and delightful places.

original: de dag de ltar dga' ba na blo 'di lta bu skye ste /
analyzed: de dag de ltar dga' ba na blo 'di lta bu skye ste /
translated: While they are enjoying themselves, the following thought occurs to them:

original: bdag cag kun phan tshun grogs su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag cag kun phan tshun grogs su gyur pa yin te /
translated: ‘We are all friends of one another.

original: lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang gi skyed mos tshal du dga' ston bya ba'i phyir 'dong ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang gi skyed mos tshal du dga' ston bya ba'i phyir 'dong ngo snyam mo //
translated: Let us go to the Sudharmā assembly hall in the Pleasure Grove of the Gods to celebrate!’

original: de nas lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba de dag thams cad kha cig ni nam mkha' la 'dzegs nas 'gro /🔽kha cig ni ngang pa'i shing rta la zhon /
analyzed: de nas lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba de dag thams cad kha cig ni nam mkha' la 'dzegs nas 'gro / kha cig ni ngang pa'i shing rta la zhon /
translated: Then, surrounded by groups of gods and goddesses, some of them fly through the sky,🔽some ride in swan-drawn chariots,

original: kha cig ni rma bya'i shing rta la zhon /
analyzed: kha cig ni rma bya'i shing rta la zhon /
translated: some ride in peacock-drawn chariots,

original: kha cig ni nam mkha' la bkad sa phub pa'i nang du zhugs /
analyzed: kha cig ni nam mkha' la bkad sa phub pa'i nang du zhugs /
translated: some enter the interior of a cloud in the sky,

original: kha cig ni gzhal med khang dang / ra ba rnam pa sna tshogs su phye ba'i nang du zhugs nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhal med khang dang / ra ba rnam pa sna tshogs su phye ba'i nang du zhugs nas /
translated: and some enter a celestial palace with various types of walls and fences.

original: brgya byin blta ba'i phyir lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang ga la ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: brgya byin blta ba'i phyir lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang ga la ba der dong ngo //
translated: They then went to Sudharmā, the assembly hall of the gods, in order to see Śakra.

original: sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / glu dbyangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phyogs thams cad rab tu 'gengs shing brgya byin gyi gnas su phyin to //
analyzed: sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / glu dbyangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phyogs thams cad rab tu 'gengs shing brgya byin gyi gnas su phyin to //
translated: With the sounds of various musical instruments, songs, and melodies, they filled all directions and arrived at Śakra’s abode.

original: de rnams kyi glu dbyangs kyi sgra snyan pa dpe med pa de thos nas /
analyzed: de rnams kyi glu dbyangs kyi sgra snyan pa dpe med pa de thos nas /
translated: Hearing the beautiful and incomparable sounds of their songs and melodies,

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyis chos bzang na gnas pa'i lha rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyis chos bzang na gnas pa'i lha rnams la smras pa /
translated: Śakra, king of the gods, said to the gods who were residing in Sudharmā,

original: kye grogs po dag /
analyzed: kye grogs po dag /
translated: “O friends,

original: dga' bar gnas pa'i lha 'di dag gang yin /
analyzed: dga' bar gnas pa'i lha 'di dag gang yin /
translated: who are these gods who are so joyful?

original: gnas ni gang na gnas /🔽de nas lha de dag gis de skad @364a *//🔽thos nas / lha de rnams myur du shes par bya ba'i phyir de nas yang lha de rnams la myur du brtags nas /
analyzed: gnas ni gang na gnas / de nas lha de dag gis de skad @364a *// thos nas / lha de rnams myur du shes par bya ba'i phyir de nas yang lha de rnams la myur du brtags nas /
translated: Where do they live?”🔽When the gods heard this,

original: brgya byin la smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin la smras pa /
translated: in order to quickly understand, they quickly examined the gods and said to Śakra,

original: brgya byin / 'di ltar lha 'di rnams ni gnas ris mthun pa na gnas pa lags te /
analyzed: brgya byin / 'di ltar lha 'di rnams ni gnas ris mthun pa na gnas pa lags te /
translated: “Śakra, these gods live in the same realm.

original: 'dir brgya byin gyi zhal mthong bar bgyi ba'i slad du mchi'o //
analyzed: 'dir brgya byin gyi zhal mthong bar bgyi ba'i slad du mchi'o //
translated: We are going to see Śakra’s face.”

original: de nas brgya byin gyis de dag la 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyis de dag la 'di skad smras so //
translated: Śakra then said to them,

original: 'di ltar yid rab tu dga' ba sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i lha khyed rnams kyang ris mthun pa'i lha rnams gang nas 'ong ba de dga' bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir bsur dengs shig /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid rab tu dga' ba sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i lha khyed rnams kyang ris mthun pa'i lha rnams gang nas 'ong ba de dga' bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir bsur dengs shig /
translated: “You gods who are so delighted and who are endowed with various musical instruments, songs, and equipment, go to welcome the gods of the same realm who are coming from there in order to enjoy themselves.”

original: brgya byin gyis de skad bsgo ba dang / chos bzang na gnas pa'i lha lag na sil snyan dang / rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs thogs pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis de skad bsgo ba dang / chos bzang na gnas pa'i lha lag na sil snyan dang / rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs thogs pa /
translated: When Śakra had given this order, the gods of Sudharma took up various musical instruments and cymbals.

original: me tog phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / byug pa dang / do shal dang / nor bu dang / rgyan phreng 'phyang ba /
analyzed: me tog phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / byug pa dang / do shal dang / nor bu dang / rgyan phreng 'phyang ba /
translated: They held flower garlands, powders, ointments, necklaces, jewels, and hanging ornaments.

original: dpung pa rnams la dpung rgyan btags pa /
analyzed: dpung pa rnams la dpung rgyan btags pa /
translated: They wore armlets on their upper arms.

original: thor tshugs dang / yid g-yos pa /
analyzed: thor tshugs dang / yid g-yos pa /
translated: Their hair was tied up, and they were agitated.

original: rin po che 'od gsal pa sna tshogs kyis lus brgyan pa /
analyzed: rin po che 'od gsal pa sna tshogs kyis lus brgyan pa /
translated: Their bodies were adorned with various bright jewels.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis lus dkar sham nyid du 'dug pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis lus dkar sham nyid du 'dug pa /
translated: Their bodies are naturally white,🔽and their bodies are illuminated by various jewels.

original: rin po che sna tshogs kyis lus gsal bar byas pa rnams ris mthun pa'i lha dag ga la ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: rin po che sna tshogs kyis lus gsal bar byas pa rnams ris mthun pa'i lha dag ga la ba der dong ngo //
translated: They go to the place where the gods of the same class are.

original: yid lhag par rab tu dga' ba de rnams phan tshun rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gran cing sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / glu dbyangs rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par dga' ba dag @364b lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
analyzed: yid lhag par rab tu dga' ba de rnams phan tshun rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gran cing sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / glu dbyangs rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par dga' ba dag @364b lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
translated: With their minds extremely joyful, they compete with each other in miraculous powers, and with various sounds of musical instruments and songs, they go to the place where Śakra, lord of the gods, is.

original: brgya byin de'i gnas su dong ngo //
analyzed: brgya byin de'i gnas su dong ngo //
translated: They go to the place of Śakra.

original: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin khang bzang ka ba 'bum snyed yod pa'i nang na rgyal ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i seng ge'i khril 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin khang bzang ka ba 'bum snyed yod pa'i nang na rgyal ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i seng ge'i khril 'dug go /
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, sits on a lion throne called Victorious in the middle of a palace with a hundred thousand pillars.

original: bde bar 'dug pa gzi brjid 'bar zhing lha 'bum snyed kyis bskor /
analyzed: bde bar 'dug pa gzi brjid 'bar zhing lha 'bum snyed kyis bskor /
translated: He sits comfortably, his splendor blazing, surrounded by a hundred thousand gods.

original: shin tu legs par byas pa rnams kyi las dag la ni nye bar spyod //
analyzed: shin tu legs par byas pa rnams kyi las dag la ni nye bar spyod //
translated: They enjoy the actions of those who have done extremely good deeds.

original: gzi brjid ni nyi ma brgya bas lhag /
analyzed: gzi brjid ni nyi ma brgya bas lhag /
translated: His splendor surpasses that of a hundred suns.

original: lha'i rgyal por gyur gyis kyang bag yod pa la ni gnas te /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal por gyur gyis kyang bag yod pa la ni gnas te /
translated: Even as he becomes king of the gods, he remains heedful.

original: lha'i rgyal po de lta bu de mthong nas /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po de lta bu de mthong nas /
translated: When the gods see such a king of the gods,

original: lha de dag thams cad yid bcu 'gyur tu rab tu dga' nas /
analyzed: lha de dag thams cad yid bcu 'gyur tu rab tu dga' nas /
translated: they become ten times more joyful.

original: brgya byin la gsong por smra zhing bro gar byed /🔽rgod bar byed la /
analyzed: brgya byin la gsong por smra zhing bro gar byed / rgod bar byed la /
translated: They speak pleasantly to Śakra and dance and play.🔽They

original: 'di ltar brgya byin la mngon par bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar brgya byin la mngon par bstod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
translated: sing these verses of praise to Śakra:

original: chos spyod rtag tu zhi ba dang // gang dag yul gyis mi gtse ba //
analyzed: chos spyod rtag tu zhi ba dang // gang dag yul gyis mi gtse ba //
translated: “Those who always practice the Dharma, who are peaceful, and who are not disturbed by objects,

original: lha rnams dang ni 'jig rten bcas //
analyzed: lha rnams dang ni 'jig rten bcas //
translated: the gods and the world

original: lha rgyal brgya byin rtag tu skyongs //
analyzed: lha rgyal brgya byin rtag tu skyongs //
translated: are always protected by Śakra, king of the gods.

original: chos kyis 'jig rten rnams 'chos kyis //
analyzed: chos kyis 'jig rten rnams 'chos kyis //
translated: The world is transformed by the Dharma.

original: chos ma yin pa ga la zhig /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ga la zhig /
translated: How could it be otherwise?

original: chos spyod rtag tu bde dang ldan //
analyzed: chos spyod rtag tu bde dang ldan //
translated: Those who practice the Dharma are always happy.

original: de las bzlog na bde ldan min //
analyzed: de las bzlog na bde ldan min //
translated: The opposite of that is not happiness.

original: chos spyod pa dang ye shes la //
analyzed: chos spyod pa dang ye shes la //
translated: Relying on the Dharma and wisdom

original: nges par bsten pa bde ba lags //
analyzed: nges par bsten pa bde ba lags //

original: gang zhig 'jig rten 'dir 'khyam zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten 'dir 'khyam zhing //
translated: Those who wander in this world,

original: gang zhig sdug bsngal des bying ba //
analyzed: gang zhig sdug bsngal des bying ba //
translated: those who are submerged in that suffering,

original: ma rig pa yis de bskyod ces //
analyzed: ma rig pa yis de bskyod ces //
translated: are shaken by ignorance,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsung ngo //
translated: so say the Tathagatas.

original: de ltar brgya byin gyis sprul pa'i gshin rje'i mi de rnams srid pa bar ma de dag la gtam brjod cing spyo bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar brgya byin gyis sprul pa'i gshin rje'i mi de rnams srid pa bar ma de dag la gtam brjod cing spyo bar byed do //
translated: Thus, Shakra's emanated Yama messengers speak and scold those in the intermediate state.

original: de nas yang brgya byin de lha de rnams la gang dud @367b 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye ba'i sprul pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nas yang brgya byin de lha de rnams la gang dud @367b 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye ba'i sprul pa ston par byed do //
translated: Then, Shakra shows the gods the emanations of those who are born among animals.

original: de rnams kyi srid pa bar ma bar de dag dang tshul mthun pa gzugs brnyan du gyur pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyi srid pa bar ma bar de dag dang tshul mthun pa gzugs brnyan du gyur pa /
translated: Their intermediate state becomes a reflection that accords with that.

original: de dang mthun pa rgya'i 'bur ltar gyur pa /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa rgya'i 'bur ltar gyur pa /
translated: It becomes like a mold for that.

original: srid pa bar ma pa'i gzugs rnam pa du ma dag byung ste /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma pa'i gzugs rnam pa du ma dag byung ste /
translated: Many forms of the intermediate existence appear.

original: de dag gcig la gcig za ba dang / gsod pa dang / ngo bo yod pa dang / ngo bo med par byed pa dang / 'jigs pa chen po skyed pa na /
analyzed: de dag gcig la gcig za ba dang / gsod pa dang / ngo bo yod pa dang / ngo bo med par byed pa dang / 'jigs pa chen po skyed pa na /
translated: They eat each other, kill each other, and create great fear.

original: der lha yid rmongs pa gang yin pa de dag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: der lha yid rmongs pa gang yin pa de dag gis mthong ngo //
translated: The gods who are confused see this.

original: de nas yang brgya byin de lha de rnams la gang yi dvags rnams kyi nang du skye ba'i sprul pa ston par byed de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas yang brgya byin de lha de rnams la gang yi dvags rnams kyi nang du skye ba'i sprul pa ston par byed de / 'di lta ste /
translated: Then Śakra shows the gods emanations of beings born among the hungry ghosts.

original: lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa //
analyzed: lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa //
translated: They have bodies tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: bzhin rtag tu skras mun par khebs pa /
analyzed: bzhin rtag tu skras mun par khebs pa /
translated: Their faces are always covered by a darkness of hair.

original: bzhin shin tu 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa /
analyzed: bzhin shin tu 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa /
translated: Their faces are extremely terrifying.🔽Their bodies are like burnt trees, with their eyes, ears, noses, and tongues pecked out by crows and owls.

original: lus tshal shing bsregs pa ltar 'dug par bya rog dang / 'ug pa rnams kyis mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce btogs pa dag lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'og gi nam mkha' de la lhung bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: lus tshal shing bsregs pa ltar 'dug par bya rog dang / 'ug pa rnams kyis mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce btogs pa dag lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'og gi nam mkha' de la lhung bar mthong ngo //
translated: They fall from the divine world into the space below.

original: de ltar lha de rnams kyis sprul pa shin tu 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa /
analyzed: de ltar lha de rnams kyis sprul pa shin tu 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa /
translated: and they become frightened.

original: rab tu dngangs par byed pa de dag mthong ba dang / de rnams kyis brgya byin de la bltas nas smras pa /
analyzed: rab tu dngangs par byed pa de dag mthong ba dang / de rnams kyis brgya byin de la bltas nas smras pa /
translated: When they look at Śakra, they say,

original: brgya byin sngon ma mthong ba'i lha ma yin nam /
analyzed: brgya byin sngon ma mthong ba'i lha ma yin nam /
translated: ‘Śakra, are these gods you have never seen before?

original: de dang tshul mthun pa gzhan rnams kyis lha 'di dag la lag ris phyin ci log tu bcings nas khrid na ci ste btang snyoms su bzhugs /
analyzed: de dang tshul mthun pa gzhan rnams kyis lha 'di dag la lag ris phyin ci log tu bcings nas khrid na ci ste btang snyoms su bzhugs /
translated: Why do you remain indifferent while others who resemble them bind the gods’ hands behind their backs and lead them away?’

original: ri rab ma lus par khyab pa lha ma yin gyi gzugs 'di dag ni /
analyzed: ri rab ma lus par khyab pa lha ma yin gyi gzugs 'di dag ni /
translated: ‘These forms of asuras that pervade all of Mount Sumeru🔽are not something we have ever seen before, Śakra.

original: sngon chad lha dang / lha ma yin thams cad g-yul 'gyed pa na bdag @368a *//
analyzed: sngon chad lha dang / lha ma yin thams cad g-yul 'gyed pa na bdag @368a *//
translated: When all the gods and asuras have fought in battle,

original: cag gis ma mthong ste /
analyzed: cag gis ma mthong ste /
translated: we have never seen this.

original: gnas 'dir ni sngon chad lha ma yin kun lan 'ga' yang ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gnas 'dir ni sngon chad lha ma yin kun lan 'ga' yang ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: In this place, all the asuras have never been before.

original: brgya byin ci /
analyzed: brgya byin ci /
translated: Śakra,

original: chos nyams phags sam /
analyzed: chos nyams phags sam /
translated: have you lost your Dharma and become a fool?’🔽‘

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten skyong ba dag sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dbang phyug khyod dang / bdag cag la dus dus su sgrol ba lags na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten skyong ba dag sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dbang phyug khyod dang / bdag cag la dus dus su sgrol ba lags na /
translated: In this way, the guardians of the world, you, the lord of the Thirty-Three, and we, are from time to time rescued.

original: 'jig rten na bar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi rgan rabs la ri mo bgyid pa dag ma mchis sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten na bar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi rgan rabs la ri mo bgyid pa dag ma mchis sam /
translated: Are there none in the world who hold their mothers and fathers as sacred, who hold ascetics and brahmins as sacred, and who honor the elders of their families?

original: brgya byin / 'jig rten na sangs rgyas mchod pa ma mchis sam /
analyzed: brgya byin / 'jig rten na sangs rgyas mchod pa ma mchis sam /
translated: Śakra said, Are there none in the world who worship the Buddha?

original: chos mchod pa ma mchis sam /
analyzed: chos mchod pa ma mchis sam /
translated: Are there none who worship the Dharma?

original: dge 'dun mchod pa ma mchis sam /
analyzed: dge 'dun mchod pa ma mchis sam /
translated: Are there none who worship the Saṅgha?

original: rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid 'chol ba ma mchis sam /
analyzed: rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid 'chol ba ma mchis sam /
translated: Are there none who do not confuse the truth of causes and effects?

original: ci na lha 'di rnams shin tu 'jigs par bgyid /
analyzed: ci na lha 'di rnams shin tu 'jigs par bgyid /
translated: Why do you frighten these gods so much?

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dbang phyug glang po che'i rgyal pos srung gi bur bcibs la g-yul bsham du gsol /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dbang phyug glang po che'i rgyal pos srung gi bur bcibs la g-yul bsham du gsol /
translated: Mount the king of elephants, the lord of the Thirty-Three, and prepare for battle.

original: lha mtshon cha sna tshogs thogs pa rnams go bskon du gsol /
analyzed: lha mtshon cha sna tshogs thogs pa rnams go bskon du gsol /
translated: Have the gods who carry various weapons put on their armor.

original: rnga bo che brdung du gsol /
analyzed: rnga bo che brdung du gsol /
translated: Beat the great drum.

original: khyod dang / bdag cag g-yul du cha bar bgyi'o zhes ris mthun pa'i lha kha cig brgya byin la de skad smra la /
analyzed: khyod dang / bdag cag g-yul du cha bar bgyi'o zhes ris mthun pa'i lha kha cig brgya byin la de skad smra la /
translated: Some gods of the same class as Śakra say to him: We will go to war with them.

original: gzhan kha cig ni ngo mtshar che ba 'di dag mthong nas yid shin tu mi dga' la /
analyzed: gzhan kha cig ni ngo mtshar che ba 'di dag mthong nas yid shin tu mi dga' la /
translated: Others, seeing these wondrous things, are very unhappy.

original: rab tu 'jigs pa'i mig dang / bzhin mog mog por gyur nas brgya byin nyid la skyabs su song ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'jigs pa'i mig dang / bzhin mog mog por gyur nas brgya byin nyid la skyabs su song ste /
translated: With eyes wide with fear and faces pale, they go to Śakra for protection.

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /
translated: They say: Lord of the gods!

original: bdag cag gi gnas 'dir sngon ma mthong ba'i lha ma yin rnams mchis kyi /🔽bdag cag bskyab @368b tu gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag gi gnas 'dir sngon ma mthong ba'i lha ma yin rnams mchis kyi / bdag cag bskyab @368b tu gsol /
translated: These asuras, never before seen in our realm, have come here.🔽Please protect us!

original: bdag cag bskyab tu gsol zhes smra'o //
analyzed: bdag cag bskyab tu gsol zhes smra'o //
translated: Please protect us!

original: de ltar 'jigs pas dkrugs pa gzhan dag brgya byin gyi drung du dong nas smras so //
analyzed: de ltar 'jigs pas dkrugs pa gzhan dag brgya byin gyi drung du dong nas smras so //
translated: Thus, others, agitated by fear, go to Śakra and say this.

original: lha gzhan dag phyis dge bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag gis sprul pa de mthong nas /
analyzed: lha gzhan dag phyis dge bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag gis sprul pa de mthong nas /
translated: Some other gods, who will later become virtuous, see that emanation and say to Śakra:

original: de nas yang snying 'jigs pa rnams lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang ga la ba der brgyugs so //
analyzed: de nas yang snying 'jigs pa rnams lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang ga la ba der brgyugs so //
translated: Then, those terrified ones rush to Sudharmā, the assembly hall of the gods.

original: yang mtshon cha don du gnyer ba gzhan dag gis ni tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams su brgyugs so //🔽der mtshon cha don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag gis sprul pa de mthong yang brgal ba'am /
analyzed: yang mtshon cha don du gnyer ba gzhan dag gis ni tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal rnams su brgyugs so // der mtshon cha don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag gis sprul pa de mthong yang brgal ba'am /
translated: Others, who were seeking weapons, ran to the groves and parks.

original: gzung bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gzung bar mi nus te /
translated: Those who were seeking weapons saw the emanation, but were unable to overpower or seize him.

original: mthong ba kho nar zad do //🔽dper na / me long gi nang na gzugs brnyan mthong yang gzung ba'am /
analyzed: mthong ba kho nar zad do // dper na / me long gi nang na gzugs brnyan mthong yang gzung ba'am /
translated: They could only see him.

original: brgal bar mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brgal bar mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like seeing a reflection in a mirror, but being unable to grasp or overpower it.

original: brgya byin des sprul pa gzhan byas pa ni ji ltar lha ma yin gyi gtso bo sgra gcan dang / brtan pa la sogs pa de ltar 'dren pa byas te /
analyzed: brgya byin des sprul pa gzhan byas pa ni ji ltar lha ma yin gyi gtso bo sgra gcan dang / brtan pa la sogs pa de ltar 'dren pa byas te /
translated: Śakra created another emanation, acting as the leader of the principal asuras, Rāhu, Sthāṇu, and so on.

original: gtso bo thams cad lag ris lag pa phyin ci log tu bcings nas rgyal cag rnams kyis 'ju bar byed /
analyzed: gtso bo thams cad lag ris lag pa phyin ci log tu bcings nas rgyal cag rnams kyis 'ju bar byed /
translated: He bound the hands of all the leaders in reverse, and the kings bound them.

original: mtshon cha rnams kyis gsheg par byed cing spyo bar byed do //
analyzed: mtshon cha rnams kyis gsheg par byed cing spyo bar byed do //
translated: They cut them with weapons and scolded them.

original: lag ris lag pa phyin ci log tu bcings pa de dag snying rje rje skad du ngu skad 'byin cing smre sngags 'don te /
analyzed: lag ris lag pa phyin ci log tu bcings pa de dag snying rje rje skad du ngu skad 'byin cing smre sngags 'don te /
translated: They wail and lament pitifully, their hands bound behind their backs.

original: lha ma yin rnams la'ang lha rnams kyis sdug bsngal sprul pa de'i nang na snang ba gang yin pa de dag stong 'gyur du snang ngo //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams la'ang lha rnams kyis sdug bsngal sprul pa de'i nang na snang ba gang yin pa de dag stong 'gyur du snang ngo //
translated: The asuras also experience a hundredfold version of the suffering that the gods emanated.

original: de dag gis kyang sprul pa gang yin pa de mthong ba dang / yang dang yang shin tu 'jigs skrag cing ngo mtshar dang 'dres pa rnams /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang sprul pa gang yin pa de mthong ba dang / yang dang yang shin tu 'jigs skrag cing ngo mtshar dang 'dres pa rnams /
translated: When they see the emanations, they become even more terrified and astonished.

original: de nas yang @369a *//🔽lha'i rgyal po brgya byin de ga la ba der dong nas /
analyzed: de nas yang @369a *// lha'i rgyal po brgya byin de ga la ba der dong nas /
translated: “Then,

original: de dag gis yang brgya byin la smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis yang brgya byin la smras pa /
translated: they go to where Śakra, lord of the gods, is and say to him,

original: brgya byin / shin tu dpung che ba 'di dag su lags /
analyzed: brgya byin / shin tu dpung che ba 'di dag su lags /
translated: ‘Śakra, who are these extremely powerful ones?

original: shin tu spro ba che ba 'di dag su lags /
analyzed: shin tu spro ba che ba 'di dag su lags /
translated: Who are these extremely enthusiastic ones?

original: 'di ltar lha dang / lha ma yin gtso bo gang lags pa de dag gi lag ris lag pa phyin ci log tu bcings nas khrid par bgyid la /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha dang / lha ma yin gtso bo gang lags pa de dag gi lag ris lag pa phyin ci log tu bcings nas khrid par bgyid la /
translated: They bind the hands of the foremost gods and asuras behind their backs and lead them away.

original: rdeg par bgyid /
analyzed: rdeg par bgyid /
translated: They beat us,

original: gsod par bgyid /
analyzed: gsod par bgyid /
translated: kill us,

original: spyo bar bgyid pa dang / shin tu spu zing zhes bgyid pa ngo mtshar che ba 'di dag ci lags /
analyzed: spyo bar bgyid pa dang / shin tu spu zing zhes bgyid pa ngo mtshar che ba 'di dag ci lags /
translated: and insult us. These amazing things that make our hair stand on end—what are they?”

original: brgya byin / bdag cag dang nye ba na mchis pa 'di dag su lags mkhyen tam /
analyzed: brgya byin / bdag cag dang nye ba na mchis pa 'di dag su lags mkhyen tam /
translated: “Śakra, do you know who these people are who have come to us?”

original: lha dang / lha ma yin gzhig par bgyi ba'i slad du lhags pa 'jig rten thams cad gzhom par bgyi ba la brtson pa /
analyzed: lha dang / lha ma yin gzhig par bgyi ba'i slad du lhags pa 'jig rten thams cad gzhom par bgyi ba la brtson pa /
translated: “They have come to destroy the gods and the asuras. They are intent on destroying the entire world.

original: 'di dag bdag cag yong ye glo bar ma chud na su lags /
analyzed: 'di dag bdag cag yong ye glo bar ma chud na su lags /
translated: We have never understood who they are.

original: gal te mkhyen na de dag bdag cag la bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: gal te mkhyen na de dag bdag cag la bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: If you know, please tell us.

original: ji ste mi mkhyen na de dag la lan ci bgyi ba dgongs su gsol ////
analyzed: ji ste mi mkhyen na de dag la lan ci bgyi ba dgongs su gsol ////
translated: If you do not know, please think about what we should do about them.”

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: The noble Dhāraṇī of the Application of Mindfulness of the True Dharma

original: bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu gcig pa /
translated: Fascicle Forty-One

original: de nas brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Śakra thought,

original: bag med pa la gnas pa'i lha 'di dag ni de kho na nyid khod du ma chud la chos la skyabs su 'gro ba la'ang brtson pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bag med pa la gnas pa'i lha 'di dag ni de kho na nyid khod du ma chud la chos la skyabs su 'gro ba la'ang brtson pa ma yin no //
translated: These careless gods do not understand reality and are not diligent in going for refuge in the Dharma.

original: de rnams kyi dregs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ngas sprul pa 'di dag byas par zad de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dregs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ngas sprul pa 'di dag byas par zad de /
translated: I have created these emanations just to remove their arrogance.

original: da 'di rnams yid byung ba dang / sems las su rung bar @369b 'gyur la /
analyzed: da 'di rnams yid byung ba dang / sems las su rung bar @369b 'gyur la /
translated: Now, they will become remorseful and their minds will become pliable.

original: sems shin tu las su rung ba'i lha gang yin pa de rnams la de bdag gis bshad par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: sems shin tu las su rung ba'i lha gang yin pa de rnams la de bdag gis bshad par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will teach those gods whose minds have become pliable.”

original: de nas sems las su rung bar rig nas brgya byin des smras pa /
analyzed: de nas sems las su rung bar rig nas brgya byin des smras pa /
translated: Then, knowing that their minds had become pliable, Śakra said:

original: 'di ltar nyon cig /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon cig /
translated: “Listen to this!

original: shin tu dpung che ba /
analyzed: shin tu dpung che ba /
translated: These armies are extremely powerful,

original: gzugs shin tu bzod par dka' ba /
analyzed: gzugs shin tu bzod par dka' ba /
translated: their forms are extremely difficult to endure,

original: kun nas gzhan 'joms par byed pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni /🔽lha 'di dag thams cad kyis dpung rnams kyis phyir gzhil ba'am /
analyzed: kun nas gzhan 'joms par byed pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni / lha 'di dag thams cad kyis dpung rnams kyis phyir gzhil ba'am /
translated: and they completely destroy others.🔽All these gods are unable to repel these armies

original: sngags rnams kyis kyang phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyis kyang phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: or turn them back with mantras.

original: khyed pas khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan gang yin pa de dag gis kyang 'di dag la mi bzod na /
analyzed: khyed pas khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan gang yin pa de dag gis kyang 'di dag la mi bzod na /
translated: “Even those who are superior to you in terms of their excellence will not tolerate them.

original: gang byad gzugs dang / mdog dang / dbang phyug dman pa khyed lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang byad gzugs dang / mdog dang / dbang phyug dman pa khyed lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of you, who are inferior in terms of your body, complexion, and power?

original: gshin rje'i pho nya 'di dag ni pho nya nag po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gshin rje'i pho nya 'di dag ni pho nya nag po zhes bya ste /
translated: “These messengers of the Lord of Death are called the ‘black messengers.’

original: gang 'chi ba'i dus la nye bar gnas pa las dang / nyon mongs pas sprel ba'i srog chags rnams bcings nas /
analyzed: gang 'chi ba'i dus la nye bar gnas pa las dang / nyon mongs pas sprel ba'i srog chags rnams bcings nas /
translated: They bind those beings who are approaching the time of death and who are bound by their karma and afflictions.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du khrid par byed do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du khrid par byed do //
translated: They lead them to the realms of hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: 'di ni 'khor ba thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi chos nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi chos nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the nature of all beings who are included in saṃsāra.

original: 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi chos brgyad yod de /
analyzed: 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi chos brgyad yod de /
translated: “There are eight qualities that pertain to beings who are included in saṃsāra.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: skyes nas 'chi ba ni gnas dang po yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas 'chi ba ni gnas dang po yin no //
translated: Birth and death are the first state.

original: nad med pa na ba ni gnas gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: nad med pa na ba ni gnas gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Health and sickness are the second state.

original: lang tsho rga ba ni gnas gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: lang tsho rga ba ni gnas gsum pa yin no //
translated: Old age and death are the third stage.

original: ldan pa las mi ldan pa ni gnas bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa las mi ldan pa ni gnas bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The fourth stage is the non-possession of what was possessed.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni @370a *//🔽las bdag gir bya ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni @370a *// las bdag gir bya ba /
translated: This world is🔽the owner of its actions.

original: las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /
analyzed: las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /
translated: It experiences the results of its actions.

original: las la rton pa yin te /
analyzed: las la rton pa yin te /
translated: It is based on its actions.

original: ji lta ji ltar dge ba'am /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar dge ba'am /
translated: In whatever way one acts,

original: sdig pa byed pa de lta de ltar las dag la spyod par 'gyur ba ni gnas lnga pa yin no //

analyzed: bag med pas phrogs pa de 'chi ba'i dus na gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is carried away by carelessness, he falls under the power of the messengers of the Lord of Death.

original: yang bag med pas phrogs pa'i sems kyi snas dri snom pa na dri zhim pa'am /
analyzed: yang bag med pas phrogs pa'i sems kyi snas dri snom pa na dri zhim pa'am /
translated: “ ‘When the nose of the careless person is carried away by the mind, he smells good and bad smells.

original: dri nga ba'am /
analyzed: dri nga ba'am /
translated: He smells good smells and bad smells.

original: me tog gi dri mi shes so //
analyzed: me tog gi dri mi shes so //
translated: They do not know the smell of flowers.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i dri'ang mi shes la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i dri'ang mi shes la /
translated: In the same way, they do not know the smell of the world,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang mi shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang mi shes so //
translated: nor do they know the smell of the world beyond.

original: bdug spos kyi dri'ang mi shes la /
analyzed: bdug spos kyi dri'ang mi shes la /
translated: They do not know the smell of incense.

original: de'i tshe bag med pa des dkon mchog gsum la res 'ga' yang bdug spos dbul ba ma phul te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bag med pa des dkon mchog gsum la res 'ga' yang bdug spos dbul ba ma phul te /
translated: At that time, because of their carelessness, they never offered incense to the Three Jewels.

original: de ltar bag med pa dag dri mi shes so //
analyzed: de ltar bag med pa dag dri mi shes so //
translated: In this way, the careless do not know smells.

original: yang bag med pas phrogs pa dag ro shes par mi 'gyur te /🔽ro myong bar byed pa na'ang blo gzhan du zhugs pas ro 'di mngar ba'am /
analyzed: yang bag med pas phrogs pa dag ro shes par mi 'gyur te / ro myong bar byed pa na'ang blo gzhan du zhugs pas ro 'di mngar ba'am /
translated: “ ‘The careless are also deprived of the knowledge of tastes.

original: skyur ba'am / lan tshva'am /
analyzed: skyur ba'am / lan tshva'am /
translated: When they experience a taste, their minds are elsewhere, so they do not know whether the taste is sweet,🔽sour, salty,

original: tsha ba'am / kha ba'am /
analyzed: tsha ba'am / kha ba'am /
translated: bitter,

original: bska ba'am / ba tshva gang yin pa mi shes pa ni de ltar gzhan du phrogs pa'i blos mi shes so; ;bag med pas phrogs pa'i blos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ro'ang mi shes la chos kyi ro'ang mi shes so //
analyzed: bska ba'am / ba tshva gang yin pa mi shes pa ni de ltar gzhan du phrogs pa'i blos mi shes so; ;bag med pas phrogs pa'i blos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ro'ang mi shes la chos kyi ro'ang mi shes so //
translated: pungent, or astringent. In this way, their minds are elsewhere and they do not know. The careless are deprived of the knowledge of the taste of the world beyond and the taste of the Dharma.🔽“ ‘

original: yang bag med pas phrogs pa'i blos lus kyis reg pa'ang mi @373a *//
analyzed: yang bag med pas phrogs pa'i blos lus kyis reg pa'ang mi @373a *//
translated: Moreover, the mind that is carried away by carelessness does not even know how to touch the body,

original: shes la / lus la rten pa'i las kyang mi byed /
analyzed: shes la / lus la rten pa'i las kyang mi byed /
translated: and does not perform actions that are based on the body.

original: khyim gyi las kyang mi shes /
analyzed: khyim gyi las kyang mi shes /
translated: It does not know how to do household work,

original: las kyi mtha' la yang mi rten /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' la yang mi rten /
translated: and does not perform any work.

original: legs par bya ba'ang ma byas /
analyzed: legs par bya ba'ang ma byas /
translated: It does not do what is good,

original: de'i khyim gyi yo byad kyang mi gsog pas de'i khyim dbul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i khyim gyi yo byad kyang mi gsog pas de'i khyim dbul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and does not accumulate the requisites for a household.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las kyang mi byed /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las kyang mi byed /
translated: It does not perform supramundane actions,

original: bla ma rnams yang mi sten cing /
analyzed: bla ma rnams yang mi sten cing /
translated: and does not attend to teachers.

original: gsong por smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gsong por smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not of the nature of one who speaks pleasantly and pays homage.

original: bag med pas phrogs pa'i blos ni reg pa'ang mi shes so //
analyzed: bag med pas phrogs pa'i blos ni reg pa'ang mi shes so //
translated: The mind that is carried away by carelessness does not even know how to touch.

original: de bzhin du yid kyis kyang gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams mi shes la /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyis kyang gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams mi shes la /
translated: In the same way, the mind does not know what is clean or unclean, what is wholesome or unwholesome, what is scriptural or non-scriptural.

original: de shi ba'i tshe 'chi ba'i chad pas nyen nas shin tu sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: de shi ba'i tshe 'chi ba'i chad pas nyen nas shin tu sdug bsngal te /
translated: When it dies, it is tormented by the pain of death and suffers greatly.

original: gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: You will fall under the power of the Lord of Death.

original: de lta bas na chos gcig cig spang bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos gcig cig spang bar bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, one thing should be given up:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: bag med pa yin no //
analyzed: bag med pa yin no //
translated: carelessness.

original: chos gnyis bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: chos gnyis bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Two things should be cultivated:🔽namely,

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo zhes gang smras pa /
translated: tranquility and insight.

original: de gnyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston pa shin tu gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ston pa shin tu gya nom pa'o //
translated: These two are the most excellent teachers for the path to nirvāṇa.

original: de la zhi gnas zhes bya ba ni chos skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas zhes bya ba ni chos skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Here, “tranquility” is the pacification of mental processes and the mental factors that have arisen and those that have not yet arisen.

original: lus dang / chos dang / sems dang / sems kyi chos dang / sems med pa'i chos dang / phyogs dkar po dang / phyogs nag po mthong bas lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: lus dang / chos dang / sems dang / sems kyi chos dang / sems med pa'i chos dang / phyogs dkar po dang / phyogs nag po mthong bas lhag mthong ngo //
translated: “Insight” is the seeing of the body, phenomena, the mind, mental phenomena, and non-mental phenomena, as well as the bright and dark sides.

original: skyon gsum spang bar bya'o zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: skyon gsum spang bar bya'o zhes gang smras pa /
translated: Three faults should be given up.

original: de la mi @373b gtsang bas ni 'dod chags spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la mi @373b gtsang bas ni 'dod chags spang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, desire is given up through the contemplation of the impure.

original: byams pas ni zhe sdang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byams pas ni zhe sdang spang bar bya'o //
translated: Hatred is given up through loving kindness.

original: ye shes kyis ni gti mug spang bar bya ste de ltar phyogs gsum mo //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni gti mug spang bar bya ste de ltar phyogs gsum mo //
translated: The third is the elimination of delusion by means of wisdom.

original: phyogs gsum gyi gnyen po'ang gsum ste /
analyzed: phyogs gsum gyi gnyen po'ang gsum ste /
translated: The antidotes to the three categories are also three.

original: de dag kyang bag med pas spong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag kyang bag med pas spong bar mi byed do //
translated: And one does not eliminate them by means of heedlessness.

original: de phyis 'chi ba'i dus yang dag par byung ba na gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyis 'chi ba'i dus yang dag par byung ba na gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, at the time of death, one falls into the power of the messengers of Yama.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four noble truths?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo zhes gang smras pa /
translated: suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.

original: de la sdug bsngal ba ni lus dang / sems kyi'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba ni lus dang / sems kyi'o //
translated: Here, suffering is that of the body and mind.

original: kun 'byung ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The origin of suffering is the origin of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: 'gog pa ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Cessation is peace.

original: lam ni yan lag brgyad de /
analyzed: lam ni yan lag brgyad de /
translated: The path has eight branches.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate these four noble truths.

original: lnga zhig legs par bsrung bar bya'o zhes gang smras pa yul lnga ste /
analyzed: lnga zhig legs par bsrung bar bya'o zhes gang smras pa yul lnga ste /
translated: As for the statement, “Five should be well guarded,” the five objects are:

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya 'di lnga bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya 'di lnga bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The five to be guarded are form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: de kho na nyid yongs su shes par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid yongs su shes par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is to be thoroughly known?

original: bsrung bar bya ba drug po /
analyzed: bsrung bar bya ba drug po /
