translated: The six to be guarded are

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po drug yul rnams la bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po drug yul rnams la bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The six faculties, such as the eyes, are to be guarded from the objects.

original: bdun zhig legs par shes par bya ba gang smras pa /
analyzed: bdun zhig legs par shes par bya ba gang smras pa /
translated: What is said to be the seven to be well understood?

original: gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yin te /
translated: They are the seven factors of awakening.

original: bdun po de byang chub kyi yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdun po de byang chub kyi yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: These seven become the factors of awakening.

original: dper na / lus kyi yan lag dang / grong khyer gyi yan lag dang / gnas kyi yan lag tu 'gyur @374a *//
analyzed: dper na / lus kyi yan lag dang / grong khyer gyi yan lag dang / gnas kyi yan lag tu 'gyur @374a *//
translated: For example, just as the limbs of the body, the limbs of a city, and the limbs of a house become so,

original: ba de bzhin du 'di dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba de bzhin du 'di dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, these become the factors of awakening.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: The branches of awakening are right mindfulness, right discernment of phenomena, right perseverance, right joy, right pliancy,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go /
translated: right concentration, and right equanimity.

original: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi mtshan nyid ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi mtshan nyid ci yin zhe na /
translated: “What is the defining characteristic of the branch of awakening of right mindfulness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'dus byas kyi chos kyi nyes dmigs kyi chos de kho na nyid bden pa bden par dran pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba bsags par dran pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos kyi nyes dmigs kyi chos de kho na nyid bden pa bden par dran pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba bsags par dran pa yin te /
translated: Mindfulness of the true reality of the faults of conditioned phenomena and mindfulness of the accumulation of the peace of nirvāṇa.

original: de ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de'i dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de'i dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first branch of awakening of right mindfulness.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gnyis pa de'i mtshan nyid ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gnyis pa de'i mtshan nyid ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the second member of enlightenment, namely, the investigation of phenomena?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: shes rab kyis don dam par 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis don dam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: By means of wisdom, one investigates the ultimate.

original: 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The investigation of phenomena is the characteristic of the reality of phenomena.

original: 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: This is the member of enlightenment that is the investigation of phenomena.

original: don de dag nyid yang dang / yang yid la byed cing 'bad pa dang / 'grus pa dang / brtson par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don de dag nyid yang dang / yang yid la byed cing 'bad pa dang / 'grus pa dang / brtson par 'gyur te /
translated: One repeatedly brings to mind, strives for, exerts oneself, and makes an effort with regard to those very objects.

original: de ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: This is the member of enlightenment that is effort.🔽One delights in and is pleased with the very objects that one brings to mind.

original: yang yid la byed @374b par mngon par 'dod cing dga' ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: yang yid la byed @374b par mngon par 'dod cing dga' ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: This is the member of enlightenment that is joy.

original: yang don de dag nyid yid la byed cing lus kyi chos dang / sems kyi chos nyid ji ltar de las su ru nga ba nyid dang / 'jam pa dang / yang ba de ltar rnal 'byor la bde ba 'du ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni /🔽shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //🔽yang don de dag nyid yid la byed cing dmigs pa las gzhan du mi gnas pa des sems 'dzin par 'gyur ba ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: yang don de dag nyid yid la byed cing lus kyi chos dang / sems kyi chos nyid ji ltar de las su ru nga ba nyid dang / 'jam pa dang / yang ba de ltar rnal 'byor la bde ba 'du ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no // yang don de dag nyid yid la byed cing dmigs pa las gzhan du mi gnas pa des sems 'dzin par 'gyur ba ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: Moreover, when one attends to those very objects, and the body and mind become fit for action, soft, and light, then the limb of enlightenment called “joy” is the cause of the arising of satisfaction in yoga.🔽Moreover, when one attends to those very objects, and the body and mind become fit for action, soft, and light, then the limb of enlightenment called “purity of equanimity” is the cause of the arising of equanimity in yoga.🔽Moreover, when one attends to those very objects, and the body and mind become fit for action, soft, and light, then the limb of enlightenment called “purity of mindfulness” is the cause of the arising of mindfulness in yoga.🔽Moreover, when one attends to those very objects, and the body and mind become fit for action, soft, and light, then the limb of enlightenment called “discrimination of dharmas” is the cause of the arising of discrimination in yoga.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin de dag nyid btang snyoms su blo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //🔽byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'bras bu sna tshogs su 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin de dag nyid btang snyoms su blo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //🔽byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'bras bu sna tshogs su 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, when one attends to those very objects, and the body and mind become fit for action, soft, and light, then the limb of enlightenment called “endeavor” is the cause of the arising of effort in yoga.🔽Moreover, when one attends to those very objects, and the body and mind become fit for action, soft, and light, then the limb of enlightenment called “joy” is the cause of the arising of satisfaction in yoga.🔽Moreover, when one attends to those very objects, and the body and mind become fit for action, soft, and light,

original: ye shes sna tshogs dang / tshul khrims sna tshogs dang / nyon mongs pa spong ba sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ye shes sna tshogs dang / tshul khrims sna tshogs dang / nyon mongs pa spong ba sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: the various knowledges, the various moralities, and the various abandonments of the defilements.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag 'di rnams dmigs pa gcig la gong nas gong du rim par 'phel la 'bras bu ni tha dad par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag 'di rnams dmigs pa gcig la gong nas gong du rim par 'phel la 'bras bu ni tha dad par 'byung ngo //
translated: These members of enlightenment, with respect to a single object, increase in a successive order, and their fruits arise separately.

original: lha dag / de ltar byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bag yod pas blta bar bya zhing yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lha dag / de ltar byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bag yod pas blta bar bya zhing yid la bya'o //
translated: Gods, you should thus watch over and attend to the seven members of enlightenment with heedfulness.

original: 'di la myos pa med pa'i bde ba tshol ba 'jig rten pha rol la 'jigs skrag pa /
analyzed: 'di la myos pa med pa'i bde ba tshol ba 'jig rten pha rol la 'jigs skrag pa /
translated: Here, one should seek the bliss of non-intoxication, fear of the other world,

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i grong gi lam tshol ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i grong gi lam tshol ba'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni /
translated: the noble eightfold path, which is the path to the city of nirvana.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / 'phags pa'i @375a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / 'phags pa'i @375a *//
translated: The noble truth of right view, the noble truth of right thought,

original: bden pa yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i ngag dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
analyzed: bden pa yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i ngag dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
translated: right view, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort,

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: lha dag / de la 'phags pa'i bden pa'i de dag thams cad ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: lha dag / de la 'phags pa'i bden pa'i de dag thams cad ci yin zhe na /
translated: “Gods, what are these noble truths?

original: 'bras bu ni ci yod /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni ci yod /
translated: What are their fruits?

original: mtshan nyid ni gang yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni gang yin /
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ci zhig dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ci zhig dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the noble eightfold path?

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin lta ba yin te; chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin lta ba yin te; chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin lta ba yin no //
translated: “The noble truth of right view is to see things as they really are, to see the specific and general characteristics of phenomena as they really are.

original: chos de dag nyid la sems skyed pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag nyid la sems skyed pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The mental factor of the generation of the mind with regard to those dharmas is right thought.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag bsdu ba ni yang dag par rtog pas ngag gi sngom pa rdzun la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ldog pa'i sdom pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i ngag yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag bsdu ba ni yang dag par rtog pas ngag gi sngom pa rdzun la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ldog pa'i sdom pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i ngag yin no //
translated: Right speech is the restraint of speech through right thought, the vow to avoid the four verbal faults such as false speech.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum ldog cing yang dag par len pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa rnam pa gsum ldog cing yang dag par len pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' yin no //
translated: Right action is the vow to avoid the three physical faults and to take up the three physical virtues.

original: mi dge ba'i chos kyi 'tsho ba ldog cing sdom pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos kyi 'tsho ba ldog cing sdom pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: Right livelihood is the vow to avoid the livelihood of unwholesome dharmas.

original: don de dag nyid yid la byed cing brtson 'grus 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba yin no //
analyzed: don de dag nyid yid la byed cing brtson 'grus 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba yin no //
translated: Right effort is the engagement in effort with the mind directed toward those very objects.

original: chos kyi don de dag nyid yid la byed cing ji ltar skyes bu dam pa'i brjed pa med pa 'di ni yang @375b dag pa'i dran pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi don de dag nyid yid la byed cing ji ltar skyes bu dam pa'i brjed pa med pa 'di ni yang @375b dag pa'i dran pa yin no //
translated: Right mindfulness is the nonforgetting of those very objects of the dharmas, as in the case of a good person.

original: chos kyi don yang dag pa de dag nyid yid la byed cing /🔽sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang nges par nyid du byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no; ;'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di dag la dmigs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos kyi don yang dag pa de dag nyid yid la byed cing / sems rtse gcig pa nyid dang nges par nyid du byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no; ;'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di dag la dmigs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is the mental activity that is focused on the true meaning of the Dharma.🔽It is the one-pointedness of mind and the certainty that is achieved through that.

original: 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one focuses on these eightfold noble paths, one will not fall under the sway of the Lord of Death’s henchmen at the time of death.

original: yang sems can dgu'i nas rgya cher blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang sems can dgu'i nas rgya cher blta bar bya ste /
translated: “Moreover, one should look at the nine types of sentient beings in detail.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dad pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dad pa ste /
translated: feeling, perception, intention, contact, mental activity, aspiration, resolution, mindfulness, concentration, and faith.

original: sa chen po pa chos gtso bo bcu po 'di dag ni sems dang lhan cig kho na skyes bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa chen po pa chos gtso bo bcu po 'di dag ni sems dang lhan cig kho na skyes bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These ten primary mental factors arise simultaneously with the mind.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba ni chos de'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid ni tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba ni chos de'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid ni tha dad pa yin la /
translated: The characteristics of these should be fully understood. The characteristics of these dharmas are distinct.

original: chos de dag ni nyi ma'i 'od zer ltar dus gcig tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos de dag ni nyi ma'i 'od zer ltar dus gcig tu 'byung ste /
translated: These dharmas arise simultaneously, like the rays of the sun.

original: chos de dag gi mtshan nyid ni mi mang mi nyung bar sems dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos de dag gi mtshan nyid ni mi mang mi nyung bar sems dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: The characteristics of these dharmas arise together with the mind, neither more nor less.

original: de la 'du shes ni yan dag par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin te; chos rnams so so'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yang dag par shes pa gang yin pa de 'du shes yin no //
analyzed: de la 'du shes ni yan dag par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin te; chos rnams so so'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yang dag par shes pa gang yin pa de 'du shes yin no //
translated: Among them, perception has the characteristic of making known the specific characteristics of dharmas. Perception is the knowledge of the specific characteristics of dharmas.

original: sems pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum la yid kyi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: sems pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum la yid kyi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Volition is the movement of the mind toward the three kinds of objects, wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is also of three kinds:

original: lus la rten pa'am dag la rten pa'am yid la rten pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: lus la rten pa'am dag la rten pa'am yid la rten pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: having the body as its object, having speech as its object, and having the mind as its object.

original: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa myong bar 'gyur ba gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa myong bar 'gyur ba gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: The three sensations are the principal elements of the three contacts.

original: myong @376a *// bar 'gyur ba gsum gyi gtso bo ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: myong @376a *// bar 'gyur ba gsum gyi gtso bo ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the principal element of the three sensations?

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The sensation of pleasure, the sensation of suffering, and the sensation of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: gtso bo yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The principal element of attention is the application to the object.

original: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i bsam pa gang yin pa'o //🔽gtso bo mos pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis spongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i spobs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i bsam pa gang yin pa'o // gtso bo mos pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis spongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i spobs pa yin no //
translated: The principal element of will is the desire to act.🔽The principal element of resolution is the certainty that arises from reflection.

original: dad pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa can nyid do //
analyzed: dad pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa can nyid do //
translated: The principal element of trust is the confidence in the object.

original: gtso bo brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni spro ba'o //🔽dran pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa mngon par ma brjed pa nyid de /
analyzed: gtso bo brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni spro ba'o // dran pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa mngon par ma brjed pa nyid de /
translated: The principal element of vigor is the enthusiasm for action.🔽The principal element of mindfulness is the non-loss of the object.

original: sems rmongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems rmongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The principal element of concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.🔽The principal element of discernment is the discernment of the object.

original: gtso bo / ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtso bo / ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: shes rab ces bya ba ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yin te /
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of dharmas.

original: gang gis chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is that by which one discerns dharmas.

original: gzhan yang sa chen po pa gzhan bcu yod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa chen po pa gzhan bcu yod la /
translated: Moreover, there are ten other great grounds:

original: chos de dag sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de dag sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du 'gyur te /
translated: When one is dying, one comes under the power of Yama's messengers,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely:🔽lack of faith,🔽remorse,🔽forgetfulness,🔽distraction,🔽bad discrimination,🔽improper mental attention,🔽wrong resolve,🔽excitement,

original: ma dad pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / brjed pa dang / sems g-yengs pa dang / shes rab 'chal pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par mos pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma rig pa dang /
analyzed: ma dad pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / brjed pa dang / sems g-yengs pa dang / shes rab 'chal pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par mos pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma rig pa dang /
translated: ignorance,🔽and

original: bag med pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'o //
translated: carelessness.

original: chos bcu bo 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po rnams yin te /
analyzed: chos bcu bo 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po rnams yin te /
translated: These ten dharmas are the great grounds of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i srid pa skyed pa gshin rje'i mis thob pa'i rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i srid pa skyed pa gshin rje'i mis thob pa'i rgyu dag yin no //
translated: They are the causes for being seized by Yama's messengers, who generate the existence of affliction.

original: de ni / gtso bo ji skad bshad pa bstan pa @376b 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / gtso bo ji skad bshad pa bstan pa @376b 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of these, which have been explained as the main ones, will now be explained.

original: de la ma dad pa zhes bya ba ni mos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ma dad pa zhes bya ba ni mos pa med pa yin te /
translated: Lack of faith is the absence of conviction.

original: gang gis chos rnams la mos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos rnams la mos pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of conviction in the Dharma.

original: le lo zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus gtong ba le lo nyid yin no //
analyzed: le lo zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus gtong ba le lo nyid yin no //
translated: Laziness is the giving up of striving.

original: brjed ngas pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la mi dran pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la mi dran pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Forgetfulness is the absence of mindfulness of the Dharma.

original: sems g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa du mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa du mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Distraction is the scattering of the mind to many objects.🔽Bad judgment is the lack of skill in the mind.

original: shes rab 'chal pa zhes bya ba ni sems mi mkhas pa'o; ;tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa ni lam ma yin pas chos rnams la tshul bzhin du sems par mi byed cing mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa zhes bya ba ni sems mi mkhas pa'o; ;tshul bzhin yid la mi byed pa ni lam ma yin pas chos rnams la tshul bzhin du sems par mi byed cing mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Improper mental orientation is the orientation of the mind to the Dharma in a way contrary to the path, as when one thinks that what is impure is pure.

original: gtso bo log par mos pa zhes bya ba ni log par 'dzin pa log par gzung nas dam du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo log par mos pa zhes bya ba ni log par 'dzin pa log par gzung nas dam du byed pa'o //
translated: Wrong resolve is the holding of a wrong view as a result of a wrong grasp, and the firm adherence to it.

original: gtso bo rgod pa zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bo rgod pa zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
translated: The main one is called “agitation” because the mind is not calm.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i chos mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i chos mi shes pa'o //
translated: “Ignorance” means not knowing the phenomena of the three realms.

original: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: “Negligence” means not practicing the wholesome dharmas.

original: nyon mongs pa de rnams ni sa chen po pa'i chos dmad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de rnams ni sa chen po pa'i chos dmad par bya ba yin no //
translated: These afflictions are the great earth-like dharmas to be despised.

original: chos bcu po gzhan sa chung du ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos bcu po gzhan sa chung du ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'byung ste /
translated: There are ten other dharmas called “small earth-like dharmas.”

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / ston pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
analyzed: khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / ston pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
translated: anger, resentment, hypocrisy, slander, deceit, guile, jealousy, stinginess, pride, and excessive pride.

original: gtso bo / chos bcu po 'di dag nyis chung dus bsdus pa yin la ma 'ongs pa dang ldan pa'i rkyen sa chung ngu ba yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo / chos bcu po 'di dag nyis chung dus bsdus pa yin la ma 'ongs pa dang ldan pa'i rkyen sa chung ngu ba yin no //
translated: These ten dharmas are included in the small earth-like dharmas, and are the conditions for possessing the future [afflictions].

original: de la khro ba zhes bya ba ni sems 'khrugs shing khros pa nyid yin no //🔽'khon du @377a *//
analyzed: de la khro ba zhes bya ba ni sems 'khrugs shing khros pa nyid yin no // 'khon du @377a *//
translated: Enmity is the persistence of anger.🔽Conceit is the exaltation of the mind.🔽Violence is the desire to kill.🔽Spite is the persistence of violence.

original: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni dgra la dam du sems pa nyid yin no //🔽ston pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa gsum gyi 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni dgra la dam du sems pa nyid yin no // ston pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa gsum gyi 'chi ba'o //
translated: Jealousy is the desire to be superior to others.

original: rab tu 'tshig pa zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pa la dam du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'tshig pa zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pa la dam du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Hypocrisy is the desire to be seen as possessing good qualities that one does not have.

original: sgyu zhes bya ba ni slu ba yin te gang gis slu bar byed pa'o //🔽skye mched bcu gnyis shes par bya zhes 'byung ba de dag gtso bo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgyu zhes bya ba ni slu ba yin te gang gis slu bar byed pa'o // skye mched bcu gnyis shes par bya zhes 'byung ba de dag gtso bo gang yin zhe na /
translated: Fraud is the desire to deceive others.🔽The twelve sense-spheres should be known.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de nang gi skye mched rnams dang / de dag gi gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos te phyi'i skye mched rnams yongs su shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de nang gi skye mched rnams dang / de dag gi gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos te phyi'i skye mched rnams yongs su shes par bya zhing /
translated: The six sense-faculties, eye, etc., are internal sense-spheres. The six objects, visible form, etc., are external sense-spheres.

original: mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / 'byung ba shas che ba rnam pa gsum yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / 'byung ba shas che ba rnam pa gsum yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The three aspects of the elements are to be understood as the characteristics, the essential nature, and the predominance.

original: de la mig gi mtshan nyid ni 'byung ba chen po dang ba /
analyzed: de la mig gi mtshan nyid ni 'byung ba chen po dang ba /
translated: The eye is the element that is clear form.

original: gzugs so sor rig par byed pa yin te /🔽de'i rgyu ni mig yin no //
analyzed: gzugs so sor rig par byed pa yin te / de'i rgyu ni mig yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the perception of form.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid yul gyi phyogs kyis khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid yul gyi phyogs kyis khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The ear, etc., are to be understood in the same way, according to their own characteristics and their objects.🔽This is the characteristic.

original: de ni mtshan nyid yin no; ;gtso bo'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid yin no; ;gtso bo'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is the essential nature of the principal element to be understood?

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: The essential nature is the non-erroneous.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen lnga dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen lnga dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The visual consciousness arises from five causes and conditions.

original: gang dag las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what does it arise?

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa dag las 'byung la /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa dag las 'byung la /
translated: It arises from the eye, form, light, space, and attention.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni de ltar mi 'byung ste /🔽mun @377b pa'am /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni de ltar mi 'byung ste /🔽mun @377b pa'am /
translated: The auditory consciousness does not arise in the same way.🔽It arises from the ear, form, space, and attention.

original: mun pa ma yin pa la'ang sgra thos par rung ngo //
analyzed: mun pa ma yin pa la'ang sgra thos par rung ngo //
translated: Sound is also heard in the absence of light.

original: de la snang ba gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de la snang ba gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: Light is not the principal factor there.

original: cung zad kyang byed pa med do //
analyzed: cung zad kyang byed pa med do //
translated: It does not do anything at all.

original: sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la'ang de bzhin du snang ba gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la'ang de bzhin du snang ba gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: The same applies to the nose, tongue, body, and mind. Light is not the principal factor there.

original: cung zad kyang byed pa med do //
analyzed: cung zad kyang byed pa med do //
translated: It does not do anything at all.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni snang ba 'byung bar yang 'gyur ba mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni snang ba 'byung bar yang 'gyur ba mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the mental consciousness, light sometimes occurs and sometimes does not occur.

original: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur la ji ltar 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na; mig gi rnam par shes pas don myong ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gang yin pa'i dmigs pa de la snang ba med na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur la ji ltar 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na; mig gi rnam par shes pas don myong ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gang yin pa'i dmigs pa de la snang ba med na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How does it occur? How does it not occur? The mental consciousness that experiences the object of the eye consciousness sometimes does not occur when there is no light.

original: lhag ma rnams la ni med kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni med kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it occurs in the absence of light in the case of the remaining sense faculties.

original: yang skye mched rnams la 'byung ba shas che ba med na mi 'byung ba yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang skye mched rnams la 'byung ba shas che ba med na mi 'byung ba yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the sense faculties should be understood in terms of the elements that are predominant in their production.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: If they are not, how can one know that they are not produced without a cause?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag gi phan tshun gnas su gyur pa /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag gi phan tshun gnas su gyur pa /
translated: The four great elements are mutually present in each other.

original: mngon par 'phel ba dang / zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'phel ba dang / zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: They increase and decrease.

original: de la mig la ni med dang / sa'i khams kyi shas che'o //
analyzed: de la mig la ni med dang / sa'i khams kyi shas che'o //
translated: In the eye, the earth element is predominant.

original: sna dang / lus la ni rlung gi khams kyi shas che'o //
analyzed: sna dang / lus la ni rlung gi khams kyi shas che'o //
translated: In the nose and body, the wind element is predominant.

original: lce la ni chu'i khams kyi shas che'o //
analyzed: lce la ni chu'i khams kyi shas che'o //
translated: In the tongue, the water element is predominant.

original: rna ba la ni nam mkha'i khams kyi shas che ste /
analyzed: rna ba la ni nam mkha'i khams kyi shas che ste /
translated: In the ear, the space element is predominant.

original: de yang gang na mgul ba dang / bu ga'i nam mkha' shas che bas zil gyis gnon par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de yang gang na mgul ba dang / bu ga'i nam mkha' shas che bas zil gyis gnon par mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, one sees that the space element is predominant in the throat and the cavities.

original: de ltar rna ba de'i 'dzin pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar rna ba de'i 'dzin pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the grasping of the ear arises.

original: de ltar skye mched rnams kyi shas che ba dang / chung ba so sor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar skye mched rnams kyi shas che ba dang / chung ba so sor shes par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should know the predominance and deficiency of the sense bases.

original: yang skye mched de rnams la rtog par byed de /🔽nye bar 'dzin @378a *//🔽pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: yang skye mched de rnams la rtog par byed de / nye bar 'dzin @378a *// pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: Moreover, one should investigate those sense bases:🔽What is the grasping of the near?

original: ring bar 'dzin pa ni gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ring bar 'dzin pa ni gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the grasping of the far?

original: de la sna dang / lce dang / lus ni nye bar 'dzin pa yin no //🔽mig ni ha cang ring ba'ang ma yin /🔽ha cang nye bar yang ma yin par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sna dang / lce dang / lus ni nye bar 'dzin pa yin no // mig ni ha cang ring ba'ang ma yin / ha cang nye bar yang ma yin par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The nose, tongue, and body sense-faculties grasp what is near.🔽The eye sense-faculty grasps what is not too far away.

original: rna ba ni ha cang ring bar 'dzin pa ma yin no //🔽sna ni shin tu nye bar 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: rna ba ni ha cang ring bar 'dzin pa ma yin no // sna ni shin tu nye bar 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The ear sense-faculty grasps what is not too close.🔽The nose sense-faculty grasps what is very close.

original: shin tu nye ba nang na yod pa'i sna chu dri mi zhim pa ji ltar myong ba rnams la snom par byed do //
analyzed: shin tu nye ba nang na yod pa'i sna chu dri mi zhim pa ji ltar myong ba rnams la snom par byed do //
translated: It smells the bad odor of the mucus that is very close, that is, inside.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'ang nang du zhugs pa'i rlung gi sgra thos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'ang nang du zhugs pa'i rlung gi sgra thos so //
translated: In the same way, the ear sense-faculty hears the sound of the wind that is inside.

original: rnam par shes pa de dag thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis shes te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de dag thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis shes te /
translated: All these consciousnesses are cognized by two consciousnesses:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the visual consciousness and the mental consciousness.

original: yang dag par 'brel ba de dag thams cad ni ji ltar mi gang zhig la bud shing tha dad pa las me tha dad par 'gyur ba de ltar na rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rgyu dang / rkyen tha dad pa la rten pa las rnam par shes pa tha dad par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par 'brel ba de dag thams cad ni ji ltar mi gang zhig la bud shing tha dad pa las me tha dad par 'gyur ba de ltar na rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rgyu dang / rkyen tha dad pa la rten pa las rnam par shes pa tha dad par 'byung ngo //
translated: All of these are correctly related, just as fire is different from the different kinds of fuel, so consciousness arises from the different causes and conditions.

original: de ltar skye mched rnams kyi gtso bo shes pa gang yin pa de ni bag med pa la gnas par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar skye mched rnams kyi gtso bo shes pa gang yin pa de ni bag med pa la gnas par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, the one who is foremost in the sense bases does not remain careless.

original: de de rnams la chags par mi 'gyur /🔽slong bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de de rnams la chags par mi 'gyur / slong bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not become attached to them.🔽He does not become greedy.

original: zhe sdang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not become angry.

original: skyes bu dam pa ni 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis 'jigs bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ni 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis 'jigs bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the holy one dies, he does not fear the messengers of the Lord of Death.

original: bzhin mi sdug par bsgyur ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhin mi sdug par bsgyur ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not fear those who have ugly faces.

original: lag ris lag pa phyin ci log tu bcings par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: lag ris lag pa phyin ci log tu bcings par mi 'gyur /
translated: His hands are not bound behind his back.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten mthong @378b bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten mthong @378b bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not see the world of Yama.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be born in the realms of hell beings, hungry ghosts, or animals.

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will experience happiness and🔽the highest bliss that arises from the end of suffering.

original: mtha' las byung ba'i shin tu bde ba myong bar 'gyur la bag med pas phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha' las byung ba'i shin tu bde ba myong bar 'gyur la bag med pas phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be carried away by carelessness.

original: yang skye mched de dag nyid la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i gnas dang / rten zil gyis gnon cing so sor rtog par byed pa ni bag med pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang skye mched de dag nyid la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i gnas dang / rten zil gyis gnon cing so sor rtog par byed pa ni bag med pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also not be carried away by carelessness with regard to the sense sources, which are impermanent, painful, empty, and without self, and which they have overcome and discerned.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa byung ba la'ang gsob gsog snying po med pa sgyu ma lta bur rtog go /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa byung ba la'ang gsob gsog snying po med pa sgyu ma lta bur rtog go /
translated: They will also think of the arising of eye consciousness as hollow, void, and insubstantial, like an illusion.

original: de zhig nas gzhan rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de nyid la'ang gsob gsog snying po med pa dang / de bzhin du nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug la so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de zhig nas gzhan rna ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de nyid la'ang gsob gsog snying po med pa dang / de bzhin du nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug la so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he discerns the six internal sense bases and the six external sense bases.

original: skye ba dang / 'jig pa dag na 'dzin par byed pa /
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig pa dag na 'dzin par byed pa /
translated: He discerns that they are grasped as arising and ceasing.

original: ro myang ba dang bcas pa rnams la mi brtan pa dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / rgyu dang / rkyen gzhan dang / gzhan dag las skyes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa de ni gzugs rnams kyis 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang bcas pa rnams la mi brtan pa dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / rgyu dang / rkyen gzhan dang / gzhan dag las skyes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa de ni gzugs rnams kyis 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He discerns that those with relishing are unstable, harmful, and arisen from other causes and conditions. He discerns that as it truly is. He is not carried away by forms.

original: de bzhin du myos pa med pa ni lha'i 'dod pa rnams la sems kun tu g-yeng bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du myos pa med pa ni lha'i 'dod pa rnams la sems kun tu g-yeng bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if he is not intoxicated, his mind is not distracted by divine pleasures,

original: mi'i 'dod pa rnams lta zhig ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: mi'i 'dod pa rnams lta zhig ga la 'gyur /
translated: how much less so by human pleasures?

original: de nas brgya byin gyis de'i tshe 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyis de'i tshe 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, spoke this verse:

original: dge ba rnams la bgegs byed pa //🔽skye mched khams @379a *//
analyzed: dge ba rnams la bgegs byed pa // skye mched khams @379a *//
translated: And create obstacles for the virtuous.

original: la rmongs pa yin //
analyzed: la rmongs pa yin //
translated: They are confused about the sense sources and elements.

original: chos rnams kun la pag med pa //
analyzed: chos rnams kun la pag med pa //
translated: They are not free from any of the phenomena

original: rab tu 'jug pa yod pa yin //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa yod pa yin //
translated: And are fully engaged in them.

original: nyes pa gsum la rnam chags pa //🔽ngan song sgor ni nye ba gang //
analyzed: nyes pa gsum la rnam chags pa // ngan song sgor ni nye ba gang //
translated: They are attached to the three faults🔽And are close to the door of the lower realms.

original: shin tu rmongs pa sdig pa'i mchog /
analyzed: shin tu rmongs pa sdig pa'i mchog /
translated: They are extremely confused and have the worst of nonvirtues.

original: bag med rab tu 'jug par byed //
analyzed: bag med rab tu 'jug par byed //
translated: They engage in carelessness.

original: byis pa bag med dga' ba gang //
analyzed: byis pa bag med dga' ba gang //
translated: Those childish ones who delight in carelessness

original: de ni 'chi ba'i lag na gnas //
analyzed: de ni 'chi ba'i lag na gnas //
translated: Are in the hands of death.

original: bag med pa la rten pa gang //
analyzed: bag med pa la rten pa gang //
translated: Those who rely on carelessness

original: de dag thams cad 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'jigs par byed //
translated: Are all terrified.

original: chos gcig las ni rnam 'das shing //
analyzed: chos gcig las ni rnam 'das shing //
translated: Those who transcend one phenomenon

original: chos gnyis la ni sems pa po //
analyzed: chos gnyis la ni sems pa po //
translated: And contemplate two phenomena

original: gnas gsum mtshan nyid rig pa gang //
analyzed: gnas gsum mtshan nyid rig pa gang //
translated: And know the characteristics of the three abodes

original: skye bo de ni bde skal ldan //
analyzed: skye bo de ni bde skal ldan //
translated: Are fortunate people.

original: gang tshe lha rnams bsod nams zad //
analyzed: gang tshe lha rnams bsod nams zad //
translated: When the gods’ merit is exhausted

original: bag med pa yis rnam par gtses //
analyzed: bag med pa yis rnam par gtses //
translated: And they are tormented by carelessness,

original: bde bas rmongs pa ltung ba gang //
analyzed: bde bas rmongs pa ltung ba gang //
translated: They fall, confused by pleasure.

original: de tshe de la su zhig skyob //
analyzed: de tshe de la su zhig skyob //
translated: Who will protect them then?

original: de tshe chos gcig dge ba ni //
analyzed: de tshe chos gcig dge ba ni //
translated: At that time, the only virtuous thing

original: bzod pa rgya cher yang dag ldan //🔽gang tshe kun nas 'byung po la //
analyzed: bzod pa rgya cher yang dag ldan // gang tshe kun nas 'byung po la //
translated: And is endowed with great patience.🔽When one is endowed with patience and compassion

original: bzod dang snying rjer ldan pa ni //
analyzed: bzod dang snying rjer ldan pa ni //
translated: Toward all beings,

original: 'di dag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe //
analyzed: 'di dag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe //
translated: At the time of death

original: 'jigs pa che la dpung du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jigs pa che la dpung du 'gyur //
translated: They become a great protection.

original: de bas bag med bral rnams kyis //
analyzed: de bas bag med bral rnams kyis //
translated: Therefore, those who are free from carelessness

original: rab tu bsgrims te bsten par bya //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrims te bsten par bya //
translated: Should rely on them with great effort.

original: ma rig pa ni spangs na dge /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni spangs na dge /
translated: When ignorance is abandoned, virtue arises;

original: rig pa rnams ni rtag tu bsrung //
analyzed: rig pa rnams ni rtag tu bsrung //
translated: The wise always protect it.🔽The wise know the difference between

original: rig pa ma rig rnam shes pa //
analyzed: rig pa ma rig rnam shes pa //
translated: Ignorance and knowledge;

original: mi de de yis gtse mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi de de yis gtse mi 'gyur //
translated: They are not harmed by it.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu'i don nges te //🔽gang zhig bag med spong ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu'i don nges te // gang zhig bag med spong ba yin //
translated: Thus, the purpose of a person🔽Is to abandon carelessness.

original: bag yod pa la dga' ba nyid //
analyzed: bag yod pa la dga' ba nyid //
translated: The one who delights in carefulness

original: de ni skyes bu'i don 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu'i don 'dod do //
translated: Is said to be a person who desires the purpose.

original: bag med 'ching ba'i zhags yin la //
analyzed: bag med 'ching ba'i zhags yin la //
translated: Carelessness is the noose of bondage;

original: de las grol ba bag yod pa //
analyzed: de las grol ba bag yod pa //
translated: Freedom from it is carefulness.

original: de dag mtshan @379b nyid mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: de dag mtshan @379b nyid mdor bsdu na //
translated: In brief, these are the characteristics

original: 'ching ba dang ni thar bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ching ba dang ni thar bar 'gyur //
translated: Of bondage and liberation.

original: 'di dag rig nas rtag tu lha //
analyzed: 'di dag rig nas rtag tu lha //
translated: Knowing this, the gods

original: bag med rnams la chags pa gang //
analyzed: bag med rnams la chags pa gang //
translated: Are attached to carelessness.

original: de ni phyi nas 'chi ba'i tshe //
analyzed: de ni phyi nas 'chi ba'i tshe //
translated: At the time of death,

original: de yi 'bras bu de shes 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu de shes 'gyur //
translated: they will understand the result of that.

original: de ltar brgya byin gyis skye mched bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bag med par 'gyur bar ba rgya cher lha rnams la ston te /
analyzed: de ltar brgya byin gyis skye mched bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bag med par 'gyur bar ba rgya cher lha rnams la ston te /
translated: In this way, Śakra extensively teaches the characteristics of the twelve sense sources to the gods in order to make them heedless.

original: gang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa /
analyzed: gang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa /
translated: Those who have previously generated roots of virtue

original: bag med pa chung ba gang yin pa de dag ni bag med pa la shin tu gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: bag med pa chung ba gang yin pa de dag ni bag med pa la shin tu gnas par mi byed de /
translated: and have little heedlessness do not remain in heedlessness.

original: chos bshad pa don yod par bya'o snyam nas de dag nyid khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: chos bshad pa don yod par bya'o snyam nas de dag nyid khong du chud par byed do //
translated: Thinking, “I will make the teaching of the Dharma meaningful,” they understand it.

original: dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams ni /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams ni /
translated: Those whose faculties are not fully ripened

original: chu bur ma smin pa brtol ba dang / gzeg pa dang / bskam pa dang / gso ba bzhin du ga la zhig khong du chud par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu bur ma smin pa brtol ba dang / gzeg pa dang / bskam pa dang / gso ba bzhin du ga la zhig khong du chud par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are like blisters that have not ripened. How could they understand the teaching, which is like a needle, a saw, a fire, and a medicine? They cannot.

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin des gong nas gong du tshig gi rim pa re res skye mched bcu gnyis dag gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin bshad cing /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin des gong nas gong du tshig gi rim pa re res skye mched bcu gnyis dag gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin bshad cing /
translated: The king of the gods Śakra explains the characteristics of the twelve sense sources in accordance with reality, one stage at a time.

original: lha de rnams la rdzu 'phrul rmad du byung ba de dag kyang bstan nas /
analyzed: lha de rnams la rdzu 'phrul rmad du byung ba de dag kyang bstan nas /
translated: Having also shown them those marvelous magical creations,

original: de nas yang rim gyis byung ba dran pa dang / 'brel pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang / rkyen dag bag med pa dang bral bar bya ba'i don du khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: de nas yang rim gyis byung ba dran pa dang / 'brel pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang / rkyen dag bag med pa dang bral bar bya ba'i don du khong du chud par byed do //
translated: he then causes them to recollect the past and to understand the characteristics of the relationships, the objects, the causes, and the conditions, in order to free them from heedlessness.

original: brgya byin de srog chags gsod pa sprul pa bstan pas 'jigs shing mi dga' ba'i lha de dag nyid nges par 'byung ba'i thabs kyi don dang / phan par bya ba'i phyir yang dang / yang du chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: brgya byin de srog chags gsod pa sprul pa bstan pas 'jigs shing mi dga' ba'i lha de dag nyid nges par 'byung ba'i thabs kyi don dang / phan par bya ba'i phyir yang dang / yang du chos ston par byed do //
translated: Śakra, having shown them the magical creations of the killing of living beings, teaches the Dharma again and again to those very gods who are frightened and unhappy, for the sake of the meaning of the method of deliverance and for the sake of benefiting them.

original: gtso bo / sems las byung ba'i g-yo zhes bya ba @380a *//
analyzed: gtso bo / sems las byung ba'i g-yo zhes bya ba @380a *//
translated: The chief mental factor is called “deception.”

original: ni drang po ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: ni drang po ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: It is the state of not being straightforward.

original: 'khor bar shin tu 'ching bar byed pa ma rungs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'khor bar shin tu 'ching bar byed pa ma rungs pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the state of being wicked, which binds one very strongly to cyclic existence.

original: phrag dog ces bya ba ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no; ;gtso bo ser sna zhes bya ba ni nor rdzas zad du dgos pas 'jigs pa nyid dang / sems las byung ba brkam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: phrag dog ces bya ba ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no; ;gtso bo ser sna zhes bya ba ni nor rdzas zad du dgos pas 'jigs pa nyid dang / sems las byung ba brkam pa nyid yin te /
translated: The chief of the secondary defilements is avarice, which is the fear of the exhaustion of possessions, and the greed that arises from the mind.

original: 'di dag ni khams gsum kun gyis las byung ba chung du yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni khams gsum kun gyis las byung ba chung du yin no //
translated: These are the minor defilements that arise from the three realms.

original: de dag kyang khams gsum du so sor dbye na du yod ce na /
analyzed: de dag kyang khams gsum du so sor dbye na du yod ce na /
translated: How many of them are there in each of the three realms?

original: khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ston pa dang / sgyu dang / 'tshig ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su 'jug la /
analyzed: khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ston pa dang / sgyu dang / 'tshig ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su 'jug la /
translated: Anger, enmity, jealousy, avarice, deceit, hypocrisy, and flattery are found in the desire realm.

original: g-yo gcig pu ni /
analyzed: g-yo gcig pu ni /
translated: Only deceit

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: is found in the desire realm and the Brahma world.

original: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal ni khams gsum car du 'byung ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal ni khams gsum car du 'byung ste /
translated: Pride and excessive pride occur in all three realms.

original: gtso bo chos bcu po 'di dag ni sa chung du las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo chos bcu po 'di dag ni sa chung du las byung ba yin no //
translated: These ten dharmas are the minor defilements that arise from the three realms.

original: gzhan yang / gtso bo dge ba chos bcu po sa chen po las byung ba yod de /🔽gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gtso bo dge ba chos bcu po sa chen po las byung ba yod de / gang zhe na /
translated: the ten wholesome factors arise from the great earth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / btang snyoms dang / 'tshe ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / btang snyoms dang / 'tshe ba med pa yin te /
translated: They are non-greed, non-hatred, shame, embarrassment, faith, pliancy, heedfulness, effort, equanimity, and non-violence.

original: dge ba 'di dag ni sa chen po las byung ba yin no //🔽de la 'di dag gi so so'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: dge ba 'di dag ni sa chen po las byung ba yin no // de la 'di dag gi so so'i mtshan nyid /
translated: These wholesome factors arise from the great earth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Here are their individual characteristics:

original: dge ba'i chos de dag thams cad kyi gzhir gyur ba @380b ni chags pa med pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag thams cad kyi gzhir gyur ba @380b ni chags pa med pa 'di yin te /
translated: Non-greed is the basis for all these wholesome factors.

original: de dag thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the root of all of them.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang med pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang med pa'ang yin no //
translated: Similarly, non-hatred is also like this.

original: ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid dben par 'dug cing bdag nyid 'jigs par sems pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid dben par 'dug cing bdag nyid 'jigs par sems pa'o //
translated: Shame means to abide in solitude and to think of oneself as fearful.

original: khrel yod pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: khrel yod pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi khrel yod pa'o //
translated: Humility is the humility of others.

original: dad pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i dang ba'o //🔽shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems dang / lus kyi sems kyi gnas ngan len sel ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: dad pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i dang ba'o // shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems dang / lus kyi sems kyi gnas ngan len sel ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind.🔽Calmness is the basis for eliminating the unwholesome tendencies of mind and body.

original: rab tu sim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu sim par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being well-disposed.

original: bag yod ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams sgrub pa'o //
translated: Conscientiousness is the practice of wholesome qualities.

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang / mi bya ba dang / rgyu dang / rkyen dag la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang / mi bya ba dang / rgyu dang / rkyen dag la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the state of being balanced with regard to what should and should not be done, and with regard to causes and conditions.

original: gtso bo mi 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la gnod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo mi 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la gnod pa med pa yin no //
translated: The principal one is non-violence, which is the absence of harm to sentient beings.

original: dge ba 'di dag ni sa chen po las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dge ba 'di dag ni sa chen po las byung ba yin te /
translated: These wholesome qualities arise from the great earth.

original: de dag bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag bshad pa yin no //
translated: They have been explained.

original: 'di dag la sems mi 'jug pa de dag ni 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi rnams kyi dbang du 'gro la /
analyzed: 'di dag la sems mi 'jug pa de dag ni 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi rnams kyi dbang du 'gro la /
translated: Those whose minds do not engage in these, when they die, go under the power of Yama's men.

original: de dag 'chi ba'i dus de'i tshe kun tu dngang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'chi ba'i dus de'i tshe kun tu dngang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of death, they will be terrified.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge bas yang dag par ma zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge bas yang dag par ma zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not sustained by virtue.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos sa chen po las byung ba ni rnams dang / dge ba sa chen po las byung ba rnams dang / chung dus chen po las byung ba rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bsdus pa'i ming ni bcu pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos sa chen po las byung ba ni rnams dang / dge ba sa chen po las byung ba rnams dang / chung dus chen po las byung ba rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bsdus pa'i ming ni bcu pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of the tenth ground is the “ground of the culmination of the great.” The qualities of the bodhisattvas on this ground are the great qualities that arise from the great ground, the great qualities that arise from the small ground, and the great qualities that arise from the medium ground.

original: yang gtso bo bcu gcig bsgom pa zhes bya ba gang yin @381a *//
analyzed: yang gtso bo bcu gcig bsgom pa zhes bya ba gang yin @381a *//
translated: “What is the practice of the eleven principal aspects?”

original: zhe na / 'di la dge slong lus dang / lus la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: zhe na / 'di la dge slong lus dang / lus la rtog par byed do //
translated: “Here, a monk contemplates the body and observes the body.

original: brtags nas kun tu chags par mi byed /
analyzed: brtags nas kun tu chags par mi byed /
translated: Having observed, he does not become attached.

original: rmongs par mi byed la de sems la dam du 'dzin par mi byed de; 'di ni bsgom pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: rmongs par mi byed la de sems la dam du 'dzin par mi byed de; 'di ni bsgom pa dang po yin no //
translated: He does not become deluded, and he does not hold the mind tightly. This is the first practice.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa la goms par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa la goms par byed de /
translated: “Moreover, a monk becomes accustomed to the practice.

original: sngon 'dod pa nye bar spyad pa gang yin pa de dag la smod par byed /
analyzed: sngon 'dod pa nye bar spyad pa gang yin pa de dag la smod par byed /
translated: He will then disparage the objects of desire that he previously indulged in.

original: ro myang bar mi byed /
analyzed: ro myang bar mi byed /
translated: He will not savor them,

original: yid la mi byed /
analyzed: yid la mi byed /
translated: he will not pay attention to them,

original: 'gyod par byed /
analyzed: 'gyod par byed /
translated: he will regret them,

original: skyon du 'grang bar byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa gnyis pa yin no //🔽gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgoms pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: skyon du 'grang bar byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa gnyis pa yin no // gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgoms pa goms par byed de /
translated: and he will see them as flaws. This is the second cultivation.

original: 'di ltar bdag bag yod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag bag yod na /
translated: “ ‘The monk who cultivates and practices will think, “If I am careful,

original: yul kun dang ldan pa'i yul rnams kyis mi 'phrogs la /
analyzed: yul kun dang ldan pa'i yul rnams kyis mi 'phrogs la /
translated: I will not be carried away by any objects of the senses.

original: pag la nyal gyi sbyor ba thams cad zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pag la nyal gyi sbyor ba thams cad zad par 'gyur te /
translated: I will exhaust all the bonds of latent tendencies.

original: de ltar bag yod pa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar bag yod pa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Thus, I will remain careful.

original: bag yod pa de sgom par byed cing /
analyzed: bag yod pa de sgom par byed cing /
translated: I will cultivate and practice carefulness.

original: goms par byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa gsum pa yin no //🔽gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: goms par byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa gsum pa yin no // gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa goms par byed de /
translated: ” This is the third cultivation.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams yid la byed cing de dag kyang goms par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams yid la byed cing de dag kyang goms par byed pa ni /
translated: “ ‘The monk who cultivates and practices will think, “I will keep in mind and cultivate virtuous qualities.

original: 'di ltar bdag gi dge ba'i chos skyes pa 'di dag ni rnam par smin pa bde ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gi dge ba'i chos skyes pa 'di dag ni rnam par smin pa bde ba /
translated: These virtuous qualities will ripen into happiness.

original: rgyu bde ba /
analyzed: rgyu bde ba /
translated: The cause is happiness.

original: rkyen bde ba yin te /
analyzed: rkyen bde ba yin te /
translated: The condition is happiness.

original: bdag la rnam par smin pa bde ba de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag la rnam par smin pa bde ba de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: I will experience happiness.

original: de bzhin du mi dge ba rnams la'ang rtog par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dge ba rnams la'ang rtog par byed la /
translated: In the same way, he should contemplate nonvirtuous actions.

original: de'i bsgom pa de ni yang dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i bsgom pa de ni yang dag par 'gyur te /
translated: His meditation will be correct.

original: 'di ni bsgom pa bzhin pa yin @381b no; ;gzhan yang dge slong de bsgom pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni bsgom pa bzhin pa yin @381b no; ;gzhan yang dge slong de bsgom pa goms par byed de /
translated: This is the meditation that is like the real thing.

original: 'di ltar bdag la tshor ba bde ba skyes pa de ci las byung /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag la tshor ba bde ba skyes pa de ci las byung /
translated: “ ‘The monk who is familiar with meditation will think, “When a pleasant feeling arises in me, what is its origin?

original: rang bzhin ci yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin ci yin /
translated: What is its nature?

original: rgyu ci yin /🔽rkyen ci yin /
analyzed: rgyu ci yin / rkyen ci yin /
translated: What is its cause?🔽What is its condition?

original: gzhi ci yin /
analyzed: gzhi ci yin /
translated: What is its basis?

original: skyes pa des bdag gi sems g-yengs par mi byed dam zhes tshor ba de dag la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin goms par byed la /
analyzed: skyes pa des bdag gi sems g-yengs par mi byed dam zhes tshor ba de dag la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin goms par byed la /
translated: When it arises, does it distract my mind? ” He should contemplate those feelings correctly.

original: de dag la'ang snying po med par lta ste /
analyzed: de dag la'ang snying po med par lta ste /
translated: He should also see that they are insubstantial.

original: gsob dang / gsog dang / snying po med par goms par byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: gsob dang / gsog dang / snying po med par goms par byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa lnga pa yin no //
translated: Contemplating them as hollow, empty, and insubstantial is the fifth meditation.

original: yang dge slong de bsgom pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: yang dge slong de bsgom pa goms par byed de /
translated: “The monk also cultivates the practice of meditation.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed gang yin pa de rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / gsog phan tshun gyi stobs kyis byung ba rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed gang yin pa de rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / gsog phan tshun gyi stobs kyis byung ba rnams 'byung ste /
translated: ‘All these formations are impermanent, painful, empty, and not self. They are like a hollow fist, a trick, an illusion, and a dream. They are produced by the power of causes and conditions.🔽They are not produced by the power of one.

original: stobs gcig gis skyid pa ma yin no zhes de ltar goms par byed do //
analyzed: stobs gcig gis skyid pa ma yin no zhes de ltar goms par byed do //
translated: ’ In this way, he cultivates the practice of meditation.🔽‘I should not be attached to them.

original: de de rnams la chags par ma byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa drug pa yin no //
analyzed: de de rnams la chags par ma byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa drug pa yin no //
translated: ’ This is the sixth meditation.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa bdun pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa bdun pa goms par byed de /
translated: “The monk also cultivates the practice of the seventh meditation.

original: 'di ltar bdag gi yid la byed pa dge ba dag skyes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gi yid la byed pa dge ba dag skyes so //
translated: ‘Virtuous thoughts have arisen in me.🔽They have arisen due to virtuous causes.

original: dge ba'i rgyus skyes pa de yid la byed pa gzhan gyis nyams te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyus skyes pa de yid la byed pa gzhan gyis nyams te /
translated: But they are destroyed by other thoughts.

original: bdag gi dmigs pa de brjed do //
analyzed: bdag gi dmigs pa de brjed do //
translated: I have forgotten that object.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi yid la byed pa mi dge ba skyes la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi yid la byed pa mi dge ba skyes la /
translated: In the same way, nonvirtuous thoughts have arisen in me.

original: de yang yid la byed pa dge bas nyams te /
analyzed: de yang yid la byed pa dge bas nyams te /
translated: But they are destroyed by virtuous thoughts.

original: bdag gi dge ba'i chos de rnams kyi bar chad byung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba'i chos de rnams kyi bar chad byung ngo snyam mo //
translated: I think that obstacles have arisen for my virtuous qualities.

original: de ltar rtag tu dmigs pa yid la byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu dmigs pa yid la byed pa 'di ni bsgom pa bdun pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh cultivation, always keeping the object in mind.

original: @382a *// gzhan yang /
analyzed: @382a *// gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dge slong de bsgom pa brgyad pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: dge slong de bsgom pa brgyad pa goms par byed de /
translated: that monk cultivates the eighth cultivation.

original: 'di ltar chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang sbyi'i mtshan nyid yin la chos 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang sbyi'i mtshan nyid yin la chos 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par 'dzin te /
translated: Thus, phenomena are one's own characteristics and general characteristics. These phenomena are grasped without distortion of one's own characteristics.

original: chos thams cad kyi 'dres pa med pa 'di nyid ni chos nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi 'dres pa med pa 'di nyid ni chos nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: This very absence of confusion of all phenomena abides as the nature of phenomena.

original: bdag skyes pa dang / gor ma chags par 'chi ba nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag skyes pa dang / gor ma chags par 'chi ba nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: One's birth and the inevitable approach of death will occur.🔽There is nothing whatsoever among conditioned phenomena that lacks the three characteristics.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos la gang mtshan nyid gsum med par gyur pa gang yang med do snyam du de ltar sgom pa ni chos thams cad kyi mi rtag pa nyid bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos la gang mtshan nyid gsum med par gyur pa gang yang med do snyam du de ltar sgom pa ni chos thams cad kyi mi rtag pa nyid bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Thus, cultivating in that way is the cultivation of the impermanence of all phenomena.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i dge slong de ni bsgom pa brgyad pa bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i dge slong de ni bsgom pa brgyad pa bsgom pa yin no //
translated: The monk who meditates in this way is practicing the eighth meditation.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa dgu pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa dgu pa goms par byed de /
translated: “ ‘The monk also practices the ninth meditation.

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum gyi gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang / byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum gyi gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang / byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag gnyen po yin te /
translated: The antidotes to the three roots of affliction—desire, anger, and ignorance—are, respectively, the meditations on impurity, loving kindness, and dependent origination.

original: de ltar goms par byed /
analyzed: de ltar goms par byed /
translated: He should practice these.

original: rtag tu yid la byed pa 'di'ang bsgom pa dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu yid la byed pa 'di'ang bsgom pa dgu pa yin no //
translated: This is also the ninth meditation, which is always to be practiced.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa bcu pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa bcu pa goms par byed de /
translated: “ ‘The monk also practices the tenth meditation.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rjes su dran pa bsgom ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rjes su dran pa bsgom ste /
translated: He should meditate on the recollection of the Buddha’s qualities.

original: de yang 'jig rten la phan pa dang / bde bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten la phan pa dang / bde bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to the world.

original: de lta bas na bdag nyid la rtag tu phan par 'dod pa rnams kyis de nyid bsgom @382b par bya'o zhes yang dag par dran par byed pa ni bsgom pa bcu pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag nyid la rtag tu phan par 'dod pa rnams kyis de nyid bsgom @382b par bya'o zhes yang dag par dran par byed pa ni bsgom pa bcu pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who always wish to benefit themselves should cultivate this truth. This is the tenth cultivation.

original: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa bcu gcig pa goms par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dge slong de bsgom pa bcu gcig pa goms par byed de /
translated: Moreover, monks cultivate the eleventh cultivation.

original: 'di ltar gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de thos pa skad cig re re la goms par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de thos pa skad cig re re la goms par byed do //
translated: They cultivate the moment-to-moment transmission of hearing.🔽They cultivate the moment-to-moment transmission of birth from the womb, birth, death, dwelling in the womb, youth, adulthood, and so on up to old age.

original: 'di ltar gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa skad cig re re ni mngal nas byung ba dang / skyes pa dang / shi ba'i bar dang / mngal na gnas ba dang / gzhon nu dang / lang tsho nas rga ba'i mthar thug gi bar du de ltar goms par byed pa dge slong de'am /🔽gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa skad cig re re ni mngal nas byung ba dang / skyes pa dang / shi ba'i bar dang / mngal na gnas ba dang / gzhon nu dang / lang tsho nas rga ba'i mthar thug gi bar du de ltar goms par byed pa dge slong de'am / gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is a monk or someone else,

original: 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du mi 'gro zhing /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe gshin rje'i mi'i dbang du mi 'gro zhing /
translated: at the time of death they will not come under the power of the Lord of Death’s henchmen.

original: bzhin mi sdug par bskyur ba sdig pa byed pa gzhan de dag kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin mi sdug par bskyur ba sdig pa byed pa gzhan de dag kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not even see the other people who are committing negative actions and have ugly faces.

original: dran pa bcu gsum dang 'brel pa legs par bsgom pa gang yin pa de dag ni phan pa dang / bde ba dang / mthar mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa bcu gsum dang 'brel pa legs par bsgom pa gang yin pa de dag ni phan pa dang / bde ba dang / mthar mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who cultivate the thirteen recollections well will be beneficial, happy, and will eventually attain nirvāṇa.

original: bcu gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirteen?

original: 'di la bag yod pa dran pa dang / nye bar gnas pa dran pa dang / g-yeng ba med pa dran pa yin te /🔽dran pa de dag la nye bar gnas nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la bag yod pa dran pa dang / nye bar gnas pa dran pa dang / g-yeng ba med pa dran pa yin te / dran pa de dag la nye bar gnas nas 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, one should recollect heedfulness, recollect being present, and recollect being undistracted.

original: bud med ces bya ba'i lus kha dog bzang po'am /
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba'i lus kha dog bzang po'am /
translated: Having become established in those recollections, one should recollect the body, which is called a woman, whether it has a good complexion or a bad complexion.

original: kha dog ngan pa mthong ba de'i nang mi gtsang ba mnam pa'i gzhi dang / mi brtan pa phyi sa'i khung ltar dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang / dran pa mi g-yo ba ni grong khyer gyi phyogs sam /
analyzed: kha dog ngan pa mthong ba de'i nang mi gtsang ba mnam pa'i gzhi dang / mi brtan pa phyi sa'i khung ltar dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang / dran pa mi g-yo ba ni grong khyer gyi phyogs sam /
translated: One should recollect the basis of the foul smell of impurities within it, recollect being present like an unstable pit of feces, and recollect being unmoving.

original: grong gi phyogs dag tu bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba'am /
analyzed: grong gi phyogs dag tu bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba'am /
translated: One should recollect the city or the village where one is going for alms.

original: yul dag tu 'gro @383a *//
analyzed: yul dag tu 'gro @383a *//
translated: When going to a village,

original: ba na bud med kyi 'du shes kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ro //
